title: Technology Contract Manager – Infrastructure & Security Operation | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fuelled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

**Are you experienced in technology, finance, and vendor management— and looking for your new challenge?** 
 Join us at SEB and help shape the future of infrastructure services in a dynamic and collaborative environment.
   

  

 Hi, I’m Andreas Hallbygård, Team Manager for Area Services within Infrastructure & Security Operations. I’m looking for a driven and solution-oriented Contract Manager to join my team, with a focus on contract, financial and service management.
   

  

**About Us**
 Infrastructure & Security Operations is part of SEB’s Technology division. Our mission is to deliver world-class infrastructure and security services in areas such as Network, Operational Security, Observability, and Cloud. My team works cross-functionally to support these delivery areas with vendor, financial and service management.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Contract Manager, you’ll be part of a team of six colleagues. You’ll take ownership of a portfolio of vendors and internal services, driving vendor governance, contract management, and financial steering throughout the full lifecycle—from onboarding to termination. You’ll work independently with your portfolio of vendors and services, but always with a “one team” mindset, supporting each other and continuously improving our ways of working. Expect close collaboration with delivery teams, legal and procurement experts, financial controllers, and external technology vendors.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Define and communicate your portfolio of services in collaboration with delivery teams.
* Set and manage budgets, including internal pricing and chargeback models.
* Own vendor relationships and contracts, including vendor governance, contract and software license management.
* Lead procurement and contract negotiations, supported by legal and procurement experts.
* Ensure compliance with third party regulatory frameworks (e.g. DORA, EBA Outsourcing) and internal guidelines.
* Conduct market analysis and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives


**Who You Are**
* You bring positive energy, a proactive mindset, and a passion for getting things done.
* Proven experience in technology vendor and contract management, ideally within infrastructure or security services.
* Strong knowledge of third-party regulations in the financial sector (e.g., DORA, EBA Outsourcing) and practical experience applying them.
* Demonstrated skills in budgeting, financial management, and charge-back models for IT services.
* Good general understanding of technology in general and IT infrastructure in particular.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, from technical teams to senior leadership.
* A collaborative, solution-oriented mindset and the ability to drive change.


**Meritorious Qualifications**
* Experience in telecommunications and network services or cybersecurity services.
* Background in designing and selling these services on the supplier side is considered an advantage.


**Ready for your next challenge?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since
 **we select candidates continuously** 
 , feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but
 **no later than** 
**30th January 2026** 
 . If you have questions about the position, please contact Andreas Hallbygård Team Manager via andreas.hallbygard@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: IT-Tekniker (M365-Specialist)
description:
Vill du vara med och stärka en samhällsviktig funktion och arbeta i en komplex miljö med höga krav på robusthet, säkerhet och samarbete, samtidigt som du utvecklar vår M365‑plattform? Hos oss finns stora möjligheter för dig som vill växa både på djupet och bredden inom ett eller flera områden. Vi skapar möjligheter och förutsättningar, sedan är det du och teamet som gör skillnaden. Var med och göra samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Skatteverket går nu in i en ny fas av uppbyggnad och innovation där vi kommer att leverera IT‑tjänster och IT‑drift till fler statliga myndigheter. För att möta detta behov skalar vi upp och stärker våra team med nya medarbetare som vill bidra till leveransen av samhällsviktiga tjänster.
   

  

 Du blir en del av Skatteverkets tekniska tjänsteenhet (STT) med cirka 600 medarbetare. Vi ansvarar för utveckling, underhåll och drift och levererar tjänster inom infrastruktur, plattformar och IT‑arbetsplats till flera myndigheter. Du tillhör Sektionen för Digitalt Samarbete med placering i Sundbyberg, där vi idag är 19 kollegor.
   

  

 Teamet du ingår i ansvarar för samarbetsplattformen med tjänster som SharePoint, Exchange, Teams och Outlook. Vi har nyligen rullat ut M365 och arbetar i en hybrid miljö som kommer att utvecklas vidare till en hybrid multitenant‑lösning när vi nu börjar leverera till fler myndigheter.
   

  

 I rollen arbetar du tillsammans med teamet för att utveckla och förvalta samarbetsplattformen både on‑prem och i M365, med särskilt fokus på Teams och Exchange. Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande och omfattar incidenthantering, felsökning, förvaltning och utveckling. Du håller dig uppdaterad om nya funktioner och rekommenderade arbetssätt inom Microsoft 365 och föreslår förbättringar som stärker säkerhet och produktivitet. Du bidrar även genom kompetensöverföring, deltagande i projekt och utveckling av interna processer och rutiner.
   

  

 Skatteverkets IT‑avdelning arbetar aktivt för att skapa en inkluderande arbetsplats präglad av jämställdhet och mångfald, där alla medarbetare får lika möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas. Läs mer på Jobba med it hos oss.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och IT-säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* vara en teamspelare och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker och att kunna tänka om när det behövs
* vara nyfiken, gilla utmaningar och ha förmågan att driva din egen och verksamhetens utveckling framåt
* ha ett strukturerat arbetssätt och god leveransförmåga
* ha god förmåga att kommunicera i tal och skrift på svenska, samt även på engelska.


 Vidare ska du även ha:
   

  

* relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom it, alternativt flerårig och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom it-området
* flerårig, aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av Microsoft Exchange Server
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av Windowsserver i större miljöer
* aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta med och förstå Active Directory, Microsoft Entra och Microsoft 365 Admin Center
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av Exchange Online och Teams, inklusive policyer, arkitektur, förvaltning, konfiguration, felsökning och integrationer
* förståelse för Microsoft Copilot-funktioner i M365 och hur dessa kan användas för att effektivisera arbete i Teams och Outlook/Exchange Online
* aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av att automatisera med hjälp av PowerShell


 Vidare är det också önskvärt att du har aktuell och relevant erfarenhet inom ett eller flera av följande områden: ITIL‑ramverket, SAFe eller andra agila arbetssätt, arbete inom offentlig sektor, hybrid‑ och multitenant‑miljöer samt low‑code‑lösningar såsom Power Automate och Power Apps.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare, med placering i Sundbyberg och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2026/79 | Kontakt: Lars Bishwa Naumanen (rekryterande chef) lars.bishwa.naumanen@skatteverket.se, Christoffer Winnow (HR-specialist) christoffer.winnow@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2026-02-04 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-02-18

title: Data Center Technician
description:
**Who are we?**
 Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, shortening the path to connectivity to enable the innovations that enrich our work, life and planet.
   

  

 A place where bold ideas are welcomed, human connection is valued, and everyone has the opportunity to shape their future.
   

  

 Joining our operations team means being at the center of everything – maintaining and evolving critical infrastructure that powers the digital world and delivers real impact for our customers, communities and society. You’ll find belonging, purpose, and a team that welcomes you—because when you feel valued, you’re empowered to do your best work.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We’re seeking a Data Center Technician to join our Nordic Operations team. These roles are ideal for individuals with hands-on technical skills who want to grow their careers in data center operations.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Hands-on Customer Support:
   

  

* Assist with customer installations and troubleshooting, including fiber cross-connects
* Provide customer support, including logistics coordination and security coverage
* Perform basic diagnostics and repairs on hardware and network equipment
* Manage internal and external tickets (including Smart Hands requests) in line with SLAs


 Operational Support
   

  

* Monitor infrastructure alarms (power, cooling, temperature, humidity) to maintain stable operations
* Support planned maintenance activities and ensure compliance with safety standards
* Assist in documentation and process updates to standardize best practices
* Participate in shift handovers and maintain accurate operational records


**Additional Responsibilities**
* Monitor infrastructure alarms (power, cooling, temperature, humidity) to maintain stable operations
* Oversee contractors, ensuring compliance with safety, cleanliness, and operational standards
* Occasional travel to other data centers for project support or escalations


**Qualifications**
* Experience in data center operations
* Hands-on experience with hardware installation and troubleshooting
* Familiarity with fiber optics and cabling (training provided)
* Ability to work in 24/7 shift rotation when required
* Strong problem-solving, multitasking, and communication skills
* Professional proficiency in English (Swedish is a plus)


 Key Skills & Experience:
   

  

* Experience in IT, Telecommunications, or data center operations
* Basic knowledge of hardware troubleshooting and installation
* Familiarity with fiber optics, structured cabling, and cross-connects
* Ability to use tools such as Fluke testers for cable and fiber testing (training provided)
* Understanding of network basics and IT systems
* Ability to work in a shift-based environment, including occasional on-call support
* Strong time management, organizational, and communication skills
* Professional proficiency in English (Swedish is an advantage)


 At Equinix, we care about our people. Our comprehensive benefits include:
   

  

* Competitive health and wellness programs
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan
* Career development and growth opportunities
* Fun, wellbeing, and charity events


 Ready to take the next step? Apply now and become part of the team that keeps the digital world running!
   

  

 Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
   

  

 Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.
   

  

**We use artificial intelligence in our hiring process. Learn more** 
**here** 
**.**

title: Technical IT Support to Polygon Group
description:
*Do you want to be the trusted, solutions‑oriented partner who gives leaders and key users a seamless IT experience? Do you enjoy taking ownership, moving fast, and making a real difference in a global environment? This could be your next step.*
**YOUR EVERYDAY WORK**
 As Technical IT Support, you’ll play a central, customer‑facing role at Polygon Group’s headquarters. You provide fast and confidential VIP support, act as on‑site support for clients, meeting rooms and networking, and serve as the escalation point for complex issues.
   

  

 You work hands‑on in Microsoft 365, manage devices through Intune, and support identity and security in Entra ID/Azure AD. You contribute to stable operations, clear documentation, and continuous improvements across an international organization.
   

  

**YOUR PROFILE**
 You’re communicative and structured, thriving close to the business. With calm professionalism and high integrity, you lead troubleshooting, set the right priorities, and create confidence for users at all levels. You take initiative, share knowledge, and build sustainable ways of working across teams and countries.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 4–6 years’ experience in IT support/second line
* Strong Microsoft 365 skills (Exchange, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive)
* Intune/Endpoint Manager for compliance, configuration, app rollout
* Entra ID/Azure AD: MFA, Conditional Access, identities
* Advanced troubleshooting of Windows 10/11, macOS, networks, meeting rooms
* Experience with ITSM tools (e.g., ServiceNow/Freshservice)
* Ability to support VIP users and handle sensitive information
* Documentation, process improvement, and runbooks
* Fluent English, spoken and written
* Team‑oriented, customer‑focused, reliable


**About Polygon Group**
 Polygon – Always by your side
   

  

 Polygon is a major worldwide player in property damage control, providing solutions to prevent, control and mitigate all kinds of property damage. The basis for our success is our +8,000 committed employees, guided by a strong corporate culture. We see ourselves as the new generation of Property Damage Control specialists – determined to drive industry transformation.
   

  

 We are based in modern offices on Mäster Samuelsgatan in central Stockholm and apply an office‑first policy across the organization.
   

  

**CONTACT**
 In this recruitment, Polygon Group is collaborating with Wise IT. If you would like to know more, please contact the responsible Recruitment Consultant Sandra Åhs at Sandra.ahs@wise.se
   

  

 Unfortunately, we cannot accept applications via email as we are committed to protecting your personal privacy. You can read more about how we process personal data in accordance with GDPR in Wise Group’s Data Processing Policy.
   

  

 We review applications on an ongoing basis, including the selection of candidates who will be invited to interview.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Data Engineer
description:
**About 0TO9**
 Ideas are everywhere, but people make them real. Founded in Stockholm in 2025 by serial entrepreneur Oliver Hildebrandt,
 **0to9** 
 is a fintech venture builder, the bank for entrepreneurship.
   

  

 We provide the capital, tech, and talent so founders can stop fighting red tape and start building. Our name reflects the building blocks of finance: with the numbers 0 through 9, you can create anything. We are building the infrastructure for the future, and we are just getting started.
   

  

**The Journey**
 As our Data Engineer, you won’t just move data, you will build the brain of our organization. You will design and own the scalable ELT pipelines that turn raw numbers into strategic impact.
   

  

**You will:**
* Build & Scale: Design ELT pipelines into Snowflake using dbt and AWS (S3, Lambda).
* Architect: Define and evolve data models (star/snowflake schemas) that power our analytics and product decisions.
* Ensure Trust: Implement robust observability and alerting to ensure our data is always reliable and high-quality.
* Collaborate: Partner with business stakeholders to translate complex requirements into clean, high-performance data products.
* Innovate: Drive engineering best practices through CI/CD, automation, and reusable code.


**Are you the one?**
 You are a builder at heart who understands that great data is the foundation of every great fintech. You enjoy the technical challenge of a modern cloud stack but also have the business grasp to know
 *why* 
 the numbers matter.
   

  

 Your Toolkit:
   

  

* Tech Stack: Strong SQL and Python skills, with hands-on experience in Snowflake and dbt.
* Cloud: Solid AWS experience (specifically S3 and Lambda).
* Engineering: A proven track record of building reliable pipelines and working with Git-based CI/CD workflows.
* Mindset: You can challenge requirements, clarify use cases, and deliver data products that actually drive decisions.


 Extra Credits / Nice to have:
   

  

* Experience with Fivetran, Omni, or Looker.
* Knowledge of orchestration tools (Airflow/Dagster) or data observability.
* A background in FinTech or high-growth finance environments.


**What’s in it for you?**
* Work from "Sweden’s Most Beautiful Office 2025" in the heart of Stockholm.
* A fast-paced, international, and entrepreneurial environment where your work has a direct impact.
* Massive opportunities to develop alongside a team that truly loves what they do.
* Be part of the leading venture builder redefining the future of finance.


**Ready to build from 0 to 9? Apply now.**

title: Alecta söker en gruppchef  till IT-infrastruktur
description:
Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren
 **Gruppchef** 
 till vår IT-avdelning med ansvar för all infrastruktur som krävs för att säkerställa en stabil och säker leverans av våra IT-tjänster. Rollen innebär att leda en grupp av specialister, 12 medarbetare och ett antal konsulter. Du är också en tydlig beställare av våra två utkontrakterade driftsmiljöer.
 


  


 Som gruppchef är du en nyckelperson i att driva utvecklingen av vår IT-infrastruktur, säkerställa hög tillgänglighet och skapa en modern, skalbar och säker IT-miljö som stödjer verksamhetens behov. Du ingår i ledningsgruppen för IT och gemensamt med övriga i ledningsgruppen ansvarar du för att driva, utveckla och leda IT avdelningen såväl taktiskt som strategiskt. Du rapporterar till chefen för IT.
 


  


**Dina ansvarsområden** 



  

  
* Leda och utveckla flera olika team av tekniska specialister inom IT-infrastruktur.
  
* Säkerställa fortsatt stabil drift, underhåll och utveckling av exempelvis nätverk, servrar, lagring, backup, systemutvecklingsverktyg och arbetsplatstjänsten.
  
* Ansvara för budget, resursplanering och leveranser inom gruppens områden.
  
* Driva förbättringsinitiativ och modernisering av infrastrukturen.
  
* Säkerställa att lösningar uppfyller krav på säkerhet, prestanda och compliance.
  


  


**Vi söker dig som** 



  

  
* Har erfarenhet av ledarskap inom IT-infrastruktur, där ditt ledarskap inspirerar och motiverar dina medarbetare att växa och ta eget ansvar.
  
* Erfarenhet av att vara beställare av och ansvara för förhandlingar och uppföljning av större sourcingavtal.
  
* Har god teknisk förståelse för nätverk, servermiljöer, virtualisering, lagring samt stordatormiljöer och molntjänster (gärna Azure).
  
* Är van att arbeta med ITIL-processer och har god förståelse för IT- och informationssäkerhet.
  
* Mod att ifrågasätta gamla sanningar.
  
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift är ett krav.
  


  


**Om Alecta och våra värderingar** 



  


 På Alecta lägger vi stor vikt vid samarbete och att dela kunskap med varandra, vi värdesätter en arbetsmiljö där alla bidrar med sin erfarenhet, talang och kultur. Du sympatiserar med Alectas uppdrag att skapa värde för våra 2,8 miljoner kunder, som också är våra ägare.
 


  


**Bli en del av ett välmående och vänligt företag** 



  


 Vi strävar efter att alltid bli bättre och värdesätter våra medarbetares initiativ och vill ge chansen till att växa hos oss. Vi sitter i stora, fina lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Vi vill att du ska må bra på jobbet och erbjuder därför goda möjligheter till balans i just ditt liv. Som anställd hos oss kommer du ha möjlighet till en del distansarbete och du kommer också att få generösa friskvårdsförmåner, tillgång till träningslokaler på jobbet, lunchsubvention och mycket mer.
 


  





  


**Information och ansökan** 



  


 För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Ulf Larsson IT-chef.
 


  


 Fackliga företrädare är Birgitta Pernkrans FORENA, Hannes Hultcrantz SACO. Vi intervjuar löpande så skicka in din ansökan snarast, sista ansökningsdag 28 februari 2026.

title: GTM-MANAGER
description:
**Your work days are brighter here.**
 We’re obsessed with making hard work pay off, for our people, our customers, and the world around us. As a Fortune 500 company and a leading AI platform for managing people, money, and agents, we’re shaping the future of work so teams can reach their potential and focus on what matters most. The minute you join, you’ll feel it. Not just in the products we build, but in how we show up for each other. Our culture is rooted in integrity, empathy, and shared enthusiasm. We’re in this together, tackling big challenges with bold ideas and genuine care. We look for curious minds and courageous collaborators who bring sun-drenched optimism and drive. Whether you're building smarter solutions, supporting customers, or creating a space where everyone belongs, you’ll do meaningful work with Workmates who’ve got your back. In return, we’ll give you the trust to take risks, the tools to grow, the skills to develop and the support of a company invested in you for the long haul. So, if you want to inspire a brighter work day for everyone, including yourself, you’ve found a match in Workday, and we hope to be a match for you too.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Workmates pride themselves on winning while having fun! That means supporting each other while driving accountability for amazing results and performance. This team is no different. Everything we do inspires a brighter work day for all. The Enterprise Sales team at Workday helps the company to continue to grow by balancing integrity and innovation, ensuring Workmates have the environment to bring their best self, and get better by pushing and developing themselves and the Workmates around them.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Here at Workday, our Account Executives are key players in our Field Sales organization. Our Customer Base sales team uses their extensive experience and consultative selling skills to initiate and support sales of Workday Solutions within Workday’s existing customers.
   

  

 This fantastic team of hardworking professionals play a key role in driving incremental add-on business into strategic named accounts. As a team, we believe that partnering with our customers to craft relevant solutions that deliver long lasting value is super important. We want to make sure that our customers are positively satisfied from day one and forever ongoing.
   

  

**About You**
**In this role, you will:**
* Be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with existing customers with a focus on upselling via deal management
* Perform account planning for assigned accounts, coordinating with pre-sales and other resources to ensure strategic alignment
* Drive strategic add-on and renewal business of Workday solutions within Medium Enterprise customers within the tech industry
* Coordinate cross functionally with Workday’s internal teams (pre-sales, digital, value & bid-management, marketing, technical and sales support)


**About You Basic Qualifications**
* 3+ years of experience selling SaaS/Cloud based ERP / HCM / Financial / Planning / or Analytics solutions to C-levels from a field sales position.
* 2+ year experience negotiating deals with a variety of C-Suite Executives to close opportunities
* 2+ years experience with building relationships with existing customers for add-on or incremental business
* 2+ year experience in developing long-term account strategies with existing customers
* Other Qualifications
* Proven track record in a high-velocity sales cycle
* Understanding of the the strategic competitive landscape of the industry by staying up to date with trends and customer needs so you can effectively position Workday solutions within accounts
* Experience leveraging and partnering with internal team members on account strategies
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills


**Our Approach to Flexible Work**
 With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply
 **spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field** 
 with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
   

  

 At Workday, we are committed to providing an accessible and inclusive hiring experience where all candidates can fully demonstrate their skills. If you require assistance or an accommodation at any point, please email accommodations@workday.com.
   

  

**Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!**
 At Workday, we value our candidates’ privacy and data security. Workday will never ask candidates to apply to jobs through websites that are not Workday Careers.
   

  

 Please be aware of sites that may ask for you to input your data in connection with a job posting that appears to be from Workday but is not.
   

  

 In addition, Workday will never ask candidates to pay a recruiting fee, or pay for consulting or coaching services, in order to apply for a job at Workday.
   

  

 ,

title: Marketing Project Manager – H&M MOVE
description:
Do you want to be part of the mission to democratize sport and get the world moving? Are you passionate about leading end‑to‑end marketing campaigns and creating impactful communication that strengthens our brand and inspires a global community? Then this might be the perfect role for you.
   

  





 At
 **H&M MOVE** 
 , we're all about celebrating movement and making it easy for everyone to get active. Our mission is simple:
 **break down the barriers to sport** 
 and make activewear more accessible for all. From day one, we've been focused on
 **democratizing sports -** 
 offering stylish, functional, and affordable activewear across a wide range of categories.
   

  





 We're bold at H&M MOVE. We’re not afraid to push boundaries, try new ideas, and reimagine what’s possible. We believe in building a team where everyone feels like they truly belong. Diversity of thought, background, and culture makes us stronger - and we’re passionate about what we do, the people we work with, and the brand we’re building.
 **This is just the beginning. Let’s move the world together.**



**Job Description**

 As a
 **Marketing Project Manager at H&M MOVE** 
 , you’ll play a central role in driving both global and local strategic initiatives that inspire people to move. You’ll lead end‑to‑end marketing and communications activities — turning insights, creativity, and purpose into impactful marketing that grows our brand and engages our global community. You’ll report to the
 **Global head of marketing at H&M MOVE,** 
 collaborate closely with teams across Marketing, Sales and Assortment— all committed to growing H&M MOVE and inspiring the world to move.
   

  





**You will:**



* Set briefs into clear, actionable strategies with defined goals, KPIs, and success metrics.
* Lead cross-functional teams across Social Media, PR, Experience, Creative Production and external partners to ensure seamless campaign execution.
* Plan and manage project timelines, production milestones, and deliverables — identifying risks early and keeping projects on track.
* Own and optimize project budgets with a performance- and impact-driven mindset, ensuring strong ROI and smart resource allocation.
* Track and evaluate project performance, gather learnings, and proactively share insights to improve future projects.
* Act as the main point of contact for internal stakeholders and external collaborators — securing alignment, clarity, and momentum throughout the entire project lifecycle.


**Qualifications**

**We’re looking for someone with:**



* Proven experience in strategic and operational marketing project management, ideally in global brand environments.
* Strong understanding of the marketing ecosystem, brand building, and channel strategy.
* Analytical, strategic and results-driven, with a passion for delivering impactful campaigns and driving continuous improvement.
* A genuine passion for movement, sportswear, fashion, and global cultural trends.
* Excellent leadership abilities, stakeholder management skills, and a natural talent for cross-functional collaboration.



**And someone who is:**



* Highly organized, proactive, curious, and comfortable leading in a fast-paced and creatively driven environment.
* Analytical and strategic, with a results-oriented mindset and a passion for delivering high-impact campaigns.
* Motivated by continuous improvement, innovation, and meaningful brand storytelling.


**Additional Information**

 This is a fulltime role based in Stockholm, time limited assignment for approx. 12-15 months.
   

  





 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application. We look forward to receiving your application no later than
 **18th of February 2026.**




**WHO WE ARE**




 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
  

  

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  




* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).


* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.


* In addition to our global benefits, our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. (Example: Competitive compensation for your dedication and long-term commitment. A day off on your birthday to relax and celebrate your special day. Special gift to celebrate the birth of your child, etc.)



**JOIN US**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

title: Manager of Join
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**




 As Manager of Join, you will lead the team responsible for creating an outstanding first impression and a seamless transition from candidate to colleague across H&M Group. You ensure that the entire Join experience end-to-end - spanning talent attraction, recruitment operations, pre boarding and employer branding - ensuring it is modern, scalable, digital and fit for a fast moving, global organisation.
   

  

  

  

 This is a senior leadership role with broad scope and real impact. You combine hands on operational expertise with the ability to lead leaders, drive change, and deliver results in complex environments.
   

  





**Key responsibilities include:**



* Lead, coach and develop leaders and specialists across Recruitment Operations, Employer Branding and Consultant Acquisition
* Drive operational excellence within the Join area, ensuring consistent, scalable, and digital ways of working across brands, regions and colleague segments
* Planning, prioritisation, and delivery of key recruitment and talent attraction initiatives including global digital implementations such as system rollouts and process harmonisation
* Strengthen recruitment processes and tools, securing data‑driven, efficient, and colleague-centered solutions
* Partner closely with leaders across the People Life Cycle team, Portfolio Brands, Regions and Group Functions to ensure business relevant, holistic and impactful solutions
* Champion continuous improvement by identifying opportunities to simplify, streamline and digitalise the end‑to‑end recruitment experience
* Act as a strong people leader and role model, empowering your team, creating clarity and fostering engagement through change



**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**




 You will be part of the People Life Cycle leadership team and report to the Head of People Life Cycle. In this role, you will collaborate closely with colleagues across the Central People Organisation, Brands, and Regions. You will also partner with leaders across Sales, Logistics, Production and Group Functions to ensure our Join practices support real business needs.
   

  





 You will work closely with the wider HR Community and external partners to ensure our Join practices remain competitive and forward looking and aligned with our strategy.
   

  

  

  





**WHO YOU ARE**




*We are looking for someone with:*



* Extensive leadership experience, including leading leaders and senior specialists
* A strong background within Talent Acquisition, Recruitment Operations, Talent Marketing, HR Business Partnering or similar areas, preferably in large and fast paced organisations
* Proven ability to plan, prioritise and deliver complex initiatives with multiple stakeholders and dependencies
* Experience driving digitalisation and implementing HR or TA technologies at scale
* A solid understanding of business operations, ideally from retail, logistics, or comparable environments, with the ability to translate business needs into effective recruitment solutions
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to turn insights into clear decisions, improvements, and actions
* Demonstrated ability to build trust, influence senior stakeholders and create clarity in complex settings



*And someone who is…*



* A collaborative and inclusive leader who believes in people and acts with integrity
* Pragmatic and solutions oriented, able to balance strategic direction with hands on execution
* Curious, forward thinking and motivated by continuous improvement
* Confident, open minded and comfortable guiding senior specialists and leaders
* A strong communicator who thrives in a global, dynamic environment



  

  





**WHO WE ARE**




 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  





  

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
  

  





 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer attractive benefits and extensive learning and development opportunities around the globe. Working in the Join area gives you the chance to shape both the colleague experience and our future talent landscape, making a real impact on the everyday life of tens of thousands of colleagues worldwide.
   

  





 You will join a passionate, ambitious and supportive team with significant opportunities to grow, influence and contribute to our transformation journey.
   

  





  

  





**JOIN US**




 Our uniqueness comes from many things; our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values and the opportunities for growth. But most of all, it is our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  





 This is a permanent position based in Stockholm, with the desired start date as soon as possible. You will report to the Head of People Life Cycle. Please apply with your CV as soon as possible, interviews will be held continuously.
   

  





*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Software Engineer/Application Engineer
description:
*Vi tror att framsteg och möjligheter skapas bäst tillsammans. Välkommen till en plats där samarbete gör skillnad.*
**Din roll**
 Som Security Engineer hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i ett drivet, cross-funktionellt team inom Group IT. Vi befinner oss i en spännande expansionsfas där IT spelar en avgörande roll för Saabs fortsatta resa. Här får du chansen att kombinera avancerad teknik med verklig samhällsnytta i en global miljö som uppmuntrar både innovation och flexibilitet.
   

  

 I rollen som Security Engineer arbetar du nära våra olika verksamhetsområden för att säkerställa att vi möter morgondagens krav på säkerhet och funktionalitet. Vi arbetar med löpande leveranser och använder moderna virtuella lösningar för parprogrammering och distanssamarbete, vilket vi varvar med fysiska teamträffar för att stärka sammanhållningen.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter:**
* Säkra behovs- och kravuppfyllnad i nära samarbete med verksamheten.
* Hantera och utveckla tekniska gränssnitt i projekt som ligger i teknikens absoluta framkant.
* Arbeta aktivt med kontinuerlig utveckling, testning och drift (CI/CD).
* Bidra till att framtidssäkra Saabs IT-landskap genom kreativa och robusta säkerhetslösningar.


**Din profil**
 Vi söker en engagerad lagspelare som drivs av nyfikenhet och vill växa i en miljö där vi vågar tänka nytt. Du är en kommunikativ person som trivs med att samarbeta på både svenska och engelska. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har en relevant utbildning i grunden och ett genuint intresse för DevSecOps-metodik.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av:**
* Förståelse för regelverk och efterlevnad (exempelvis NIST och NATO Restricted).
* Containers och Kubernetes (inklusive YAML).
* Automation, CI/CD och Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Git och öppen källkod (FOSS).
* Testning och testautomation.


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Vad blir du en del av**
 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 27 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.

title: Airport representative
description:
EF Education First is looking for friendly, high-energy team players to support our students at Arlanda Airport this summer. You’ll be the first face our language students see when they are embarking on their journey and the first one to welcome them back when they return back to Sweden — helping them get from A to B smoothly, safely, and with a smile.
   

  

**🛫** 
**What you’ll do:**
* Meet & greet students at Arlanda
* Help guide them to connecting flights
* Keep things running smoothly (even when it’s a little chaotic)
* Be in touch with our head office & local teams
* Solve unexpected hiccups like lost bags or delays


**🙌** 
**What we’re looking for:**
* You speak Swedish fluently & English like a pro
* You’re calm under pressure and quick on your feet
* You love working with people and as part of a team
* You’re studying (or interested in) travel, events, logistics, or service
* Bonus if you’ve worked in airports, events, or travel before


**💡** 
**Why join?**
* Flexible work hours, often you are free during mid days and work only related to when our students flights departs and arrives
* Real-world experience in travel & logistics
* Fun, fast-paced international vibe
* Looks 🔥 on a CV


**About EF Education First**
 At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs—focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics—turn dreams into international opportunities.
   

  

 When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about—we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, caste, parental status, identity, experience and everything else that makes you unique.
   

  

 Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://www.ef.com.
   

  

 EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults. All positions are subject to a criminal background and/or reference checks, as applicable.

title: Director Analyst - IT Services Sourcing (Remote: Europe)
description:
**About the role:**
 Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, taking strong positions, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Director serves as a leader within Gartner’s Business and Technology Insights (BTI) group. Utilizing research and analytical skills, a Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives and their mission critical priorities. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner’s value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Take strong positions, create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged “must-have research” content
* Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
* Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client’s barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
* Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
* Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
* Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
* Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings
* Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
* Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
* Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
* Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
* Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery
* Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
* Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions


**What you will need:**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience; Graduate degree preferred
* 10+ years of relevant field or industry experience
* Sourcing managed services experience is required in 2 of the "Must-Have" markets below, additional experience in "Other-Markets" is a plus.
* Expertise in all phases of sourcing for IT services from 3rd party providers (outsourcing). This includes ability to review RFPs, statements of work, contract terms, SLAs for outsourced (onshore/offshore/nearshore) IT services deals.
* Knowledge of Global IT service providers (service integrators) is a must and knowledge of how services are delivered in NAM is desired along with a competitive interplay between incumbents, emerging providers, disruptors, and outsourcers. Additional knowledge on other markets, such as EMEA, APC and ANZ is optimal.


***Must-Have Market Knowledge (preference for experience in 2 out of 3):***
* BPO Services: Procurement and HR BPO services are outsourced managed services which include end to end functional process execution and support using either client’s technology or vendor provided technology. Procurement BPO includes both category management and P2P processes, where HR includes payroll and benefits business process outsourcing
* Managed Data & Analytics Services: D&A is the management of data for all uses (operational and analytical) and the analysis of data to drive business processes and improve business outcomes through more effective decision making and enhanced customer experiences. Service offerings include Analytics and business intelligence (BI), Data integration, Data management (and data governance), Data quality, Data science and ML, Master data management and Metadata management
* IT Infrastructure services outsourcing including managed cloud services, data center outsourcing, service integration and management (SIAM) and digital workplace services.


***Other-Markets (in order of preference)***
* Cloud Transformation Services .ie Preparing and moving applications to the Cloud
* Outsourcing Applications & Infrastructure (Hosting) Services (including offshore, nearshore) from strategy, supplier selection, contracts, and management of deal
* Cloud Hosting services including hyperscalers such as AWS and Azure.
* Demonstrate executive presence; can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders
* Custom Development Services i.e Custom platforms, Web/Mobile, API, integrations
* Enterprise Solutions implementations services (e.g., ERPs like SAP S4Hana, Oracle cloud, MS Dynamics, Desktop /Helpdesk solutions like Outlook365, ServiceNow. HCM and CRM SaaS Solutions like Workday, Salesforce etc .)


**Additional Skills Required**
* Strong organizational skills; ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
* Demonstrate excellence in research and writing ability
* Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills; ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions
* Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges
* Strong communicator who is able to explain complex concepts concisely and simply
* Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
* Strong business and financial acumen
* Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
* Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
* Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
* Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
* Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)


 #Remote
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective business and technology insights, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our vast, virtually untapped market potential offers limitless opportunities – opportunities that may not even exist right now – for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:107685
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Senior Offensive Security Engineer - Red Team
description:
**What you will do** 




 The Red Team operator will perform dedicated Red Team activities simulating known threat actors, to help strengthen Klarna's overall security posture and determine the impact and likelihood of threat actors to accomplish objectives across the Kill Chain and MITRE ATT&CK Framework.
 



 In this role, you’ll emulate both internal and external threat actors to uncover weaknesses across our most critical products and infrastructure. Everything from designing real-world attack scenarios to conducting deep technical assessments.
 


* Break into (and out of) all the things.
* Conduct red team assessments against internal, public-facing, and cloud assets.
* Perform Initial access campaigns such as Phishing and other Social Engineering activities.
* Move laterally between endpoints, cloud, IoT, and whatever else stands between you and the engagement goal.
* Develop offensive security tools for internal and public use.
* Provide expert guidance to developers, other security teams, and the SOC in investigating issues.
* pread awareness of offensive security practices via demos, workshops, and training.







**Who you are** 



* Strong experience red teaming and performing other technical security assessments, with and without automated tools.
* Strong Opsec focus.
* Strong experience of testing Cloud Native environments and CI/CD pipelines using a mix of macOS, Linux, and Windows endpoints.
* Comfortable communicating findings clearly and effectively to both technical and nontechnical audiences, with concrete remediation recommendations beyond simple issue reporting.
* Experience with programming and contributing to large and small projects in C, Go, Perl, or whatever other language is best suited to the task.



**Awesome to have** 



* Industry recognized certifications
* A degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
* Contributions to the larger cybersecurity community



 Please include a CV in English.
 



 Curious to learn more about Klarna and what it’s like to work here? Explore our career site!

title: Marketing Manager (Hybrid)
description:
Website: https://mindfriendpro.com/ & https://mindfriend.com
   

  

 linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/mindfriendpro
   

  

**MindFriend | Mental Health & Psychology Platform**
**Location:** 
 Hybrid (Europe-based preferred, flexible)
   

  

**Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Mind Friend** 
 is on a mission to revolutionize mental well-being/community connection. We are looking for a powerhouse
 **Marketing Manager** 
 who lives at the intersection of data-driven growth and creative storytelling.
   

  

**If you are a strategist who still loves to execute, and you know how to scale a brand from "niche" to "household name," we want to meet you.**
**The Role**
 This is a high-impact, hybrid role. You won't just be managing a budget; you'll be the architect of our entire growth engine. You'll oversee everything from the visual identity of our brand to the granular optimization of our conversion funnels.
   

  

**Requirements**
****What You'll Do****
* Strategic Growth: Develop and execute an omni-channel marketing roadmap that balances short-term wins (leads/sales) with long-term brand equity
* Paid & Organic Mastery: Manage full-funnel performance marketing (Meta, Google, LinkedIn) while simultaneously building a self-sustaining organic ecosystem
* Brand & Identity: Guard and evolve the Mind Friend voice and visual identity, ensuring every touchpoint feels cohesive and premium
* Content & Social: Lead our social media strategy to drive engagement, community sentiment, and viral potential
* Optimization & Scaling: Use rigorous A/B testing and data analytics to improve CAC, LTV, and ROAS. If it can be measured, you'll optimize it
* Hands-on Execution: From writing high-converting copy to setting up automation workflows, you are a "doer" first


**Who You Are**
* The Full-Stack Marketer: You have 5+ years of experience across the marketing spectrum (Growth, Brand, and Social)
* Data-Obsessed: You don't make moves based on "vibes." You use data to tell a story and justify your strategy
* Agile: You thrive in a fast-paced environment and can pivot quickly when the data tells you to
* Creative Intuition: You have a sharp eye for design and a "ear" for brand voice
* Tech Savvy: Expert-level knowledge of ad managers, analytics tools (GA4), and CRM/automation platforms


**How To Apply**
 Think you're the right "Mind Friend" for the job? Send us your portfolio, your resume, and a brief note on the one marketing campaign you're most proud of.
   

  

**Benefits**
****Why Join Us?****
 At Mind Friend, we believe in
 **Performance-Based Prosperity.** 
 We aren't looking for someone to just punch a clock; we're looking for a partner in our success.
   

  

**Our Promise:** 
 Your compensation is tied to your impact. As we see the brand grow, your salary grows with it. We are committed to rewarding the tangible benefits, successful projects, and scaled growth that your work brings to the table.
   

  

* Hybrid Flexibility: The best of both worlds collaborative in-person energy and focused remote deep-work
* Direct Impact: No corporate red tape. Your ideas move from brainstorm to execution fast
* Evolutionary Pay: A salary structure that scales alongside our KPIs and your career milestones

title: Domänarkitekt - IT Säkerhet
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens IT-säkerhet i en av Sveriges ledande bankkoncerner? Hos oss får du arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där säkerhetsarbetet gör verklig skillnad – varje dag. Tillsammans med engagerade kollegor får du möjlighet att påverka, utvecklas och bidra till en tryggare digital värld. Välkommen till ett team som kombinerar hög kompetens med nyfikenhet, humor och ett starkt säkerhetstänk!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som IT-säkerhetsarkitekt med domänansvar blir du en nyckelspelare i vårt arbete med att utveckla och säkerställa bankens målarkitektur inom säkerhet. Du arbetar brett inom banken och tillsammans med LFAB-koncernen för att proaktivt förhindra säkerhetsincidenter och skapa effektiva styrmodeller. I nära samarbete med kollegor inom informationssäkerhet, dataskydd och IT-säkerhet bidrar du till att utveckla styrande dokument, processer och arbetsrutiner. Du rapporterar till Chef Banksäkerhet och ingår i ett team där variation, utveckling och samarbete står i centrum.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Driva, underhålla och utveckla bankens strategiska målarkitektur inom IT-säkerhetsområdet utifrån affärs- och verksamhetsbehov.
* Samarbeta med verksamhetsrepresentanter, IT-team och andra intressenter för att ge arkitekturstöd och leda det operativa arkitekturarbetet.
* Ta fram, underhålla och dokumentera arkitekturartefakter såsom principer, riktlinjer, styrmodeller, processer, metodik, ramverk och beslutsunderlag.
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av beslutade arkitekturprinciper och regler genom att identifiera, analysera och agera på säkerhetsrisker i projekt, processer och system.
* Ge strategiskt och tekniskt stöd i projekt, upphandlingsstöd och rådgivning kring säkerhetslösningar och tekniska kontroller.
* Delta i forum, samarbeten och utbildningar för att bidra till effektiva leveranser och en lärande säkerhetskultur.
* Omvärldsbevaka och identifiera möjligheter till innovation, automation och förbättringar inom IT-säkerhet.


 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Högskoleexamen inom relevant område.
* 5–7 års erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-säkerhet i komplexa miljöer.
* Erfarenhet som ledande arkitekt eller i en senior teknisk roll.
* Erfarenhet av att använda arkitektur som styr- och förändringsinstrument på både strategisk och operativ nivå.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnplattformar (t.ex. Azure, AWS eller GCP) och säkerhetsarkitektur i molnet.
* Bred och djup teknisk förståelse inom IT-infrastruktur, nätverkskommunikation, utveckling, integrationsplattformar, lagring, backup och AI.
* Erfarenhet av agil utvecklingsmetodik och kultur (motsvarande SAFe / DevSecOps).
* Kunskap om CI/CD-pipelines.
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.
* Certifiering inom arkitektur och erfarenhet av standarder som SABSA eller TOGAF.
* Kännedom om regelverk som påverkar banksektorn (t.ex. DORA, GDPR, PCI-DSS).


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Kunskap om krypteringstekniker, nyckelhantering (KMS/HSM) och PKI.
* Kunskap om API:er och mikrotjänster.
* Bred och djup teknisk förståelse för applikationssäkerhet.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av bank eller motsvarande reglerad verksamhet.


 Som person är du en analytisk lagspelare med starkt driv och passion för IT-säkerhet, där ”Security by Design” är en självklarhet. Du är självgående, strukturerad och lösningsfokuserad, med en tydlig förmåga att arbeta målinriktat. Din kommunikativa förmåga gör att du enkelt etablerar och underhåller ett brett kontaktnät i komplexa organisationer, och du bidrar till en positiv och trivsam arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter:**
 Rekryterande chef: jonny.knutas@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Forena: jessica.loow@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen: christina.berg@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
 Länsförsäkringar AB är en inkluderande arbetsplats där mod, möjligheter och engagemang står i centrum. Vi erbjuder ett hållbart arbetsliv med flexibla villkor och satsar på att alla medarbetare ska kunna växa och trivas, oavsett bakgrund.
   

  

 Länsförsäkringar Bank är en av Sveriges största och mest omtyckta banker, med ett brett utbud av tjänster inom betalningar, sparande, bolån och fonder. I arbetet mot vår vision "Tillsammans skapar vi trygghet och möjligheter" hoppas vi att du vill bidra med ditt engagemang och nyfikenhet för effektivisering, AI samt omvärldsspaning av moderna verktyg och metoder för att driva vår utveckling framåt.

title: Human Resource Business Partner(HRBP)
description:
**About Huawei**
 Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.
   

  

 At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward. With approximately 208,000 employees, we operate in more than 170 countries and regions.
   

  

 Huawei's end-to-end portfolio of products, solutions and services are both competitive and secure. Through open collaboration with ecosystem partners, we create lasting value for our customers, working to empower people, enrich home life, and inspire innovation in organizations of all shapes and sizes.
   

  

**Job Title: Human Resource Business Partner(HRBP)**
**Job Location: (SoIna, Sweden)**
**Main Responsibilities:**
 As HRBP， you’ll have a variety of tasks and you’ll be the interface towards external suppliers, managers and employees. You’ll have the following main responsibilities and tasks:
   

  

* Business Requirement Alignment and HR Solution Customization
* Deeply understand the needs of a single business unit and be familiar with HR policies and processes.
* Capable of addressing key issues, participating in solution design, and driving implementation.
* HR Process Operations and Enablement
* Efficiently execute the company's HR processes (e.g., recruitment, assignment, etc.).
* Enhance the HR management capabilities of frontline managers through training and tool support.
* Talent Acquisition and Strategy Optimization
* Responsible for the recruitment of the assigned module (campus/senior/external recruitment, etc.) and for connecting with relevant channels.
* Participate in internal improvement (e.g., interview evaluation) and learning to ensure the quality of talent supply.
* Project Management and Business Outcome Orientation
* Plan and implement talent supply projects, taking responsibility for business outcomes.
* Drive special projects (e.g., annual campus recruitment activities, talent acquisition initiatives).


**Requirements:**
* Hold a bachelor's degree in Human Resource Management or a related field
* At least 2 years of experience in human resources, preferably with experience in a recruitment specialist or generalist HR role
* Proficient in multiple languages, including English, Chinese, and Swedish; knowledge of Chinese is preferred
* Excellent internal communication and problem-solving skills
* Strong time management, prioritization, and organizational skills
* Proficient in using the Microsoft Office suite
* Experience working in an international company is preferred


**What We Offer:** 
 We offer you an exciting professional career in one of the leading and fastest growing multinational telecommunication companies, challenging work and a competitive salary package. Personal development is ensured through many training opportunities across Europe.
   

  

**Important:** 
 To be considered for this role, applicants must be eligible to work and live in the job location.
   

  

**Privacy Statement:**
 We are committed to protecting your privacy by following the applicable data protection legislation. By applying to this position at Huawei, you acknowledge that you have read and understood the Huawei Recruitment Privacy Statement containing information on how we process your data. Please note that your data will be treated confidentially and securely.
   

  

 You can contact us by clicking here to get information about Huawei, contact Huawei’s DPO, submit any requests regarding your personal data, exercise your privacy rights, or submit any questions, comments, or suggestions related to the Privacy Statement.

title: Software Engineer (IaaS)
description:
Everyone's story matters. Come shape your story with us at Riverty.
   

  

**But where does that take you?**
 To one of our 30 hybrid workspaces – designed for exchanging ideas, learning from others, and shaping the way we work. An international community of over 4,000 people, representing almost 80 nationalities across 11 countries. United by one mission: Combining empathy, advanced technology and data-driven insights to keep people and businesses in flow. With payments made for them. So that they don't have to worry about it.
   

  

**And there's more:** 
 We are part of the family-owned Bertelsmann group. Established. Corporate. In a fast-paced industry. We enable flexible payments in various industries, simplifying the financial management of known brands and helping people repay debt to build financial confidence. In short: shaping FinTech.
   

  

**We are looking for**
**Software Engineer**
**to join our team at our location in Stockholm**
**(Y)our Mission:**
 Our solutions contribute to flexible and customer-friendly payment alternatives. We allow consumers to choose when and how they want to pay, guaranteeing merchants a steady and predictable cash flow. Our products make us proud, but not content, and we have high ambitions for our existing and upcoming products. We’re now modernizing and strengthening one of our key products with renewed focus in the Nordics — backed by the strength of a global group, but with the energy and ownership of a startup. You’ll join a newly formed product & tech team, helping shape how we work and how we grow as we double down on building sustainable, human-centric FinTech solutions.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* In this role, you will work as a full-stack engineer, primarily focusing on backend tasks and having smaller front-end responsibilities. You will join one of our products, and your daily tasks will be:
* Design, develop, test, and ship robust, maintainable, and readable software, applications, APIs, and other workflows.
* Attend regular scrum ceremonies as a member of an agile cross-functional team.
* Analyze, discuss and implement business requirements while maintaining good documentation of the systems and components you create.
* Adopt, implement, and provide feedback on organizational and industry standards and practices that will positively impact on our engineering culture.


  

  

**What will help you to succeed in the role:**
* A university degree in the IT field
* Hands-on experience with C# and the .NET framework.
* Experience in frontend development with any modern JavaScript framework (e.g., Angular).
* Some experience in developing, shipping, and maintaining cloud-based applications.
* A good understanding of RESTful APIs.
* Familiarity with microservices and distributed architecture is a plus.
* Experience with relational databases, preferably SQL Server.
* Knowledge of cloud development and experience with Azure is a bonus.
* Written and spoken English proficiency to communicate and collaborate with our international team.


**About the technologies we use:**
 Our teams have autonomy regarding tech choices. The example below will give you some insights, and we look forward to discussing this further.
   

  

 All solutions developed cloud-native targeting Azure - Infrastructure defined using Terraform - Services deployed to Kubernetes clusters by default - A growing microservice ecosystem with event-based integration - Using latest .NET Core - RESTful API design - Single-page frontend apps served by CDN - Frontend tech using TypeScript, often Angular or standard Web Components (Stencil) - Automated tests in each layer - Design collaboration using Figma.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
   

  

 We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Head of P&C Operations and Technology
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose smoke-free enjoyment. How? By offering people other nicotine products online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with eleven store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 300 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to smoke-free alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 We are now looking for a Head of P&C Operations and Technology to build and lead our global People technology and process landscape. You will ensure our systems, data, and workflows are scalable, compliant, and support a seamless employee experience across all markets.
   

  

 This is a hands-on role where you combine long-term roadmap ownership with daily operational execution. You will own our HCM system, master data, and core employee lifecycle processes, and act as the key link between People & Culture (P&C), Finance, IT, and external vendors. You will join a fast-paced, close-knit P&C team where collaboration, trust, and a high degree of ownership define how we work. We move quickly, support each other, and value open dialogue and diverse perspectives.
   

  

 The team operates with high energy, strong collaboration, and a culture that encourages contribution, healthy challenge, and real impact. The role is ideally based in Stockholm (or within commuting distance), with an expectation of being in the office three days per week. For the right candidate, we are also open to a UK‑based setup, with regular travel to Stockholm.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**People Tech & Process Ownership**
* Product Owner and Superuser for our HCM / core HR system, accountable for system configuration, data integrity, releases, and continuous improvement
* Accountable for people analytics and reporting, delivering accurate standard and ad-hoc insights from HR systems to support People & Culture, Finance, and leadership decision-making
* Own and continuously improve HR master data and end-to-end employee lifecycle processes
* Lead systems and workflows covering absence, time management, travel, and expense
* Implement and optimise tools supporting Talent Acquisition (TA), Compensation & Benefits (C&B), Learning & Development (L&D), and Performance Management
* Ensure data quality, standardisation, scalability, and audit readiness across all People systems


**Payroll & Vendor Governance**
* Support global payroll vendor governance in close collaboration with C&B, ensuring aligned data flows, integrations, and operational accuracy
* Strengthen payroll-related compliance, controls, and operational stability across markets


**Roadmap, Compliance & Analytics**
* Drive the global People Tech & Operations roadmap
* Ensure compliance with regulations and internal controls
* Own people analytics and reporting
* Support Employer of Record solutions


**Operational Enablement & Change**
* Implement new systems and workflows
* Lead release management and testing
* Drive change management and training
* Act as interface between P&C, Finance, and IT


**What We Are Looking For**
* Strong project and program management skills, with experience delivering complex HR Tech or HR Operations initiatives end to end
* Solid understanding of change management, including stakeholder engagement, adoption, and enablement across multiple markets and user groups
* Understanding of employee lifecycle processes in international settings
* Comfortable navigating HR, Finance, IT, and vendor landscapes
* Experience from global or multi-country environments
