 I rollen som operatör för ärenden med hemliga tvångsmedel arbetar du med inhämtning, bearbetning och analys av uppgifter som inkommer via hemliga tvångsmedel. Du arbetar minutoperativt och behöver kunna ta egna initiativ samt aktivt söka information ifrån olika IT-system.
   

  

 Du har kontakt med landets spaningsgrupper för att delge ärendeinformation samt lämna biträde i den dagliga spaningsverksamheten. Det kräver en god förmåga att filtrera information och kunna fatta snabba beslut.
   

  

 I större ärenden har du ett utpekat ärendeansvar, ingår i ett team med spaningskoordinator, utredare, spanare, analytiker och åklagare och deltar i utredningsgruppens ärendemöten.
   

  

 Då arbetsinflödet förändras snabbt är det viktigt att du lätt kan växla tempo och snabbt anpassa dig till förändringar och nya förutsättningar.
   

  

 Arbetstiderna varierar utifrån den operativa situationen.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:**
* Svensk polisexamen, i enlighet med Polisförordningen (2014:1104)
* God förmåga och intresse att sätta dig in i olika IT-system
* Erfarenhet av spanings- och/eller utredningsverksamhet
* Goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift
* Svenskt medborgarskap


 Det är
 **meriterande** 
 om du även har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete med hemliga tvångsmedel
* Ytterligare språkkunskaper


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Då rollen innebär både självständigt arbete och arbete i team ser vi det som naturligt att du är lösningsorienterad och engagerad för att kunna hantera olika typer av ärenden och arbetsuppgifter. Att kommunicera med andra yrkesgrupper på ett konstruktivt sätt utgör en stor del av det dagliga arbetet, vilket förutsätter att du har en god förmåga till samarbete. För att trivas i rollen behöver du vara driven samt ha intresse kring vad som behövs för att driva ett ärende i mål. Du kommer hantera olika arbetsuppgifter parallellt och stundtals är arbetsbelastningen hög vilket ställer krav på simultankapacitet och din förmåga att prioritera. Vidare har du ett högt säkerhetsmedvetande och besitter en hög grad av yrkesmässig integritet.
   

  

 För denna centrala funktion i verksamheten lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Har du frågor om uppdraget är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef: Christina Andersson, gruppchef, på 073-843 78 63 eller christina-a.andersson@polisen.se.
   

  

 Undrar du något om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta ansvarig HR-konsult Dana Däversjö på 073-086 97 80 eller dana.daversjo@polisen.se.
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Saco-S, saco-s.avdelningarna@polisen.se
   

  

 Polisförbundet, Sofia Ask, tfn 010-563 87 10
   

  

 ST, st.inom-polisen@polisen.se
   

  

 Seko Polisen, Karna Tillheden, tfn 073-249 04 22
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Anställningsform:
 **Tillsvidareanställning.** 
 Sex månaders provanställning kan komma att tillämpas
   

  

 Anställningsbenämning: Polisinspektör
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Arbetstid: Förtroendearbetstid
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Funktion: Operatör teknikspaning
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Det är därför viktigt att du svarar tydligt och utförligt på frågorna och inte hänvisar till andra handlingar t.ex. CV.
 **Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.**
**Besvara följande urvalsfrågor som en del av din ansökan:**
* Har du svensk polisexamen? (ja/nej)
* Beskriv din IT-vana kortfattat. Ge gärna exempel på IT-system som du har god kunskap inom / erfarenhet av
* Har du erfarenhet av spanings- och/eller utredningsverksamhet? Om ja: beskriv kortfattat din erfarenhet
* Beskriv din nivå i talad och skriven svenska
* Beskriv din nivå i talad och skriven engelska
* Har du svenskt medborgarskap? ja/nej
* Har du erfarenhet av arbete med hemliga tvångsmedel? Om ja: beskriv kortfattat hur lång erfarenhet, på vilket sätt du har arbetat med hemliga tvångsmedel, annat av relevans
* Har du ytterligare språkkunskaper? Om ja, beskriv vilket/vilka språk och på vilken nivå


 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och besvarade urvalsfrågor via e-post till jobb.noa@polisen.se
 **senast den 5 februari 2026** 
 . Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen.
 **Märk din ansökan med referensnummer A025.625/2026 i mailets ärendemening.**
 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning under https://polisen.se/krigsplacering och https://polisen.se/sakerhetsprovning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering
   

  

 Din ansökan är en allmän handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.
   

  

***Polismyndigheten***
*Polismyndigheten erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling. Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen på https://polisen.se/erbjudande*
*Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen.*
*Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet på www.polisen.se
   

 www.polisen.se*
**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Vi undanber oss samtal och mejl från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Domain Architect - Payments
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 As a Domain Architect (DA), you will be responsible for designing, optimizing, and governing the architecture of our Payments domain with a main focus on evolving our Payments gateway, within our organization. As a DA, you will ensure that our systems and solutions are scalable and reliable and align with the overall enterprise architecture, business goals, and industry best practices. You will belong to the architect team within Payments and report to the Head of Engineering.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Develop and maintain the architecture for the Payments domain.
* Define architecture principles, models, and guidelines.
* Ensure the architecture is scalable, resilient, and aligned with business and overall IT strategies.
* Work closely with business stakeholders such as PMs (Product Managers) and POs (Product Owners) to understand their needs and translate them into architectural solutions.
* Define and enforce architectural standards, best practices, and governance processes.
* Responsible for maintaining and further developing the technical roadmap for the payments domain.
* Drive continuous improvement in the Payment architecture, ensuring it evolves in response to changing business needs and technological advancements as well as legal requirements.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation of the architecture, including diagrams, models, and decision logs.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* 3+ years of experience in architecture roles, specializing in leading the design of robust, scalable, and efficient components and features for complex systems.
* Deep understanding of technologies and tools related to cloud platforms (GCP).
* Ability to align domain-specific solutions with broader business and IT strategies.
* Strong ability to articulate complex architectural concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to tackle domain-specific challenges.
* Ability to lead and mentor teams, driving collaboration across multiple departments and influencing architectural decisions.


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Understanding and experience of payment specifics such as card processing, open banking and APM (Alternative Payment Methods) integrations.
* Development experience, using Java/Kotlin, Spring Boot, MySQL and Kafka.


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Partner Manager - Channels (Nordics)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Channel & Alliances sales professional to ignite and nurture partnerships by identifying and recruiting new partners for long-term success as well as manage ongoing relationships with key strategic partners, including managed services providers, professional services partners, resellers and cloud provider alliances. Our ultimate goal is developing alliances that drive both customer adoption and new revenue. This is a great opportunity for you to join a cloud software company and help blaze the path for our company's growth.
   

  

*At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds, and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.*
**What You’ll Do:**
* Identify and recruit new strategic CSP/MSP and SI partners to drive revenue growth
* Enable and activate existing partners through training, enablement and joint selling
* Coordinate the technical and marketing aspects of integrated partnership launches
* Host quarterly business reviews with partners to drive accountability and report on success metrics
* Work hand-in-hand with Datadog’s regional enterprise and commercial sales organizations
* Generate partner-sourced net-new sales pipeline and revenue


**Who You Are:**
* 5+ years of experience in business development, strategic alliances, or channel sales at a cloud services or software as a service organization
* Proven experience in driving sales opportunities from lead generation to closure, effectively negotiating agreements and building long-lasting partnerships
* Ability to quickly understand technical concepts and architectural scenarios, and explain them to others verbally and in writing
* Willingness to travel 25-50% of the time


**Bonus points:**
* Experience with systems management or monitoring
* Experience with partnerships supporting DevOps, particularly in a cloud environment
* Technical background/education
* Entrepreneurial mindset with a passion for taking initiatives from ideation to impact
* Passion for fast-paced, sometimes unpredictable growth culture and environment
* Experience in identifying market opportunities with a track record of initiating go-to-market plans and sales follow-through


*Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.*
**Benefits and Growth:**
* Continuous Sales training and career growth
* New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan
* Generous and competitive global and US benefits
* Friendly and inclusive workplace culture


*Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.*
**About Datadog:**
 Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity at Datadog:**
 Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.
   

  

 Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete this form. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.
   

  

**Privacy and AI Guidelines:**
 Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. For information on our AI policy, please visit Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines.

title: Researcher in demography
emails: eleonora.mussino@sociology.su.se, st@st.su.se, st@st.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, sekodirekt@seko.se, sekodirekt@seko.se
description:
**The Department of Sociology** 
 at Stockholm University is one of the biggest departments at the Faculty of Social Science with about 85 employees, 600 annual students and contains the Stockholm University Demography Unit (SUDA).
   

  

 More information about us, please visit: The Department of Sociology.
   

  

 Project description
   

  

 The position will be associated with SUDA’s research on Family policies and Migrant integration: understanding parental leave and childhood education and care use and their consequences among migrants in Sweden.
   

  

 www.su.se/english/research/research-projects/family-policies-and-migrant-integration
   

  

 Main responsibilities
   

  

 The position involves data analysis and write a scientific paper on how reforms in parental leave policies affect migrant’s use.
   

  

 Qualification requirements
   

  

 Researchers are appointed primarily for purposes of research and must hold a Swedish doctoral degree or an equivalent degree from another country.
   

  

 Assessment criteria
   

  

 In the appointment process, special attention will be given to research skills and the applicant’s previous publications records in relation to this project. The applicant needs to demonstrate solid experience with quantitative research and specific experience with longitudinal data (preferably with register data experience). Researchers should have demographic research experience.
   

  

**About The Employment**
 The position involves full-time employment for 3 months, with the possibility of extension under special circumstances. Start date 1 March 2026, or by agreement.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 With us, you will experience the dynamic interaction between higher education and research that makes Stockholm University an exciting and creative environment. You will work in an international environment and get favourable conditions. The university is located in the National City Park with good transport links to the city.
   

  

 Stockholm University strives to be a workplace free from discrimination and with equal opportunities for all.
   

  

 Contact
   

  

 Further information about the position can be obtained from Eleonora Mussino, eleonora.mussino@sociology.su.se.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Apply for the position at Stockholm University's recruitment system. Attach a personal letter and CV as well as the attachments requested in the application form. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete in accordance with the instructions in the job advertisement, and that it is submitted before the deadline.
   

  

 The instructions for applicants are available at: How to apply for a position.
   

  

 Stockholm University contributes to the development of sustainable democratic society through knowledge, enlightenment and the pursuit of truth.

title: Head of Finance and Accounting
description:
**About the role** 




 Zendr is seeking an experienced Head of Finance and Accounting who will play a key role during the scale-up period.
 



 As the one of the leaders of the finance team, you will be focused on building and growing the finance function, implementing best practice around reporting both internally and externally for investors. You will have strong control of the financial numbers, and required to partner closely with the CFO and other heads of departments to continue to drive Zendr’s ambitious growth plans.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**Financial Leadership & Stewardship:** 



* Own all finance-related operations, core accounting, financial reporting, payroll and invoicing processes
* Lead and develop a team of currently two finance managers who are owning customer and supplier invoicing
* Implement robust accounting policies, compliance processes, and internal controls, for example around accruals and cut-off dates
* Effectively manage the current outsourced book-keeping agency, while progressively internalizing critical accounting activities to build a disciplined in-house finance function
* Drive automation of the finance function and use software to boost efficiency, speed, accuracy, and quality of insights wherever possible
* Lead the consolidation of accounts from different group entities as the company expands



  





**Financial Strategy & Infrastructure:** 



* Support the CFO in building financial insights and KPIs by ensuring accurate, timely, and well structured underlying financial data.
* Develop capital-efficient financing and funding strategies, including alternative sources such as debt financing, grants, and tax credits
* Support accounting related M&A activities, including financial due diligence and financial PMI
* Design and implement a scalable finance infrastructure, including systems, processes, data models as well as the use of AI that support Zendr’s continued growth



  





**Board & Shareholder Communications:** 



* Produce robust and timely monthly management accounts and KPIs for reporting to the management team and the board



  





**About you** 




 The ideal candidate will be a strategic and results-oriented financial operator with a proven track record in high-growth operationally-intensive companies, who has been responsible for financial processes and outputs and delivered tangible improvements to financial processes.
 



  





**Key attributes of the successful candidate include:** 



* **Ownership & Mindset:** 
 Comfortable being personally accountable for financial accuracy and engaging directly with key stakeholders. Brings a hands-on, can-do attitude and pragmatic problem-solving mindset, valuing ownership, curiosity, and execution as highly as prior experience.
* **Professional Training:** 
 Formal training in accounting (audit firm or equivalent), preferably with Big 4 or leading accounting firm background combined with hands-on in-house experience, ideally from a transaction-heavy or platform-based business
* **Prior Experience:** 
 At least five years of experience in accounting, financial control, managing day-to-day accounting, finance and cash management
* **Demonstrated ownership and leadership:** 
 Clear examples of leading key financial processes hands-on and delivering robust financial outputs for management review
* **Financial Expertise:** 
 Thorough understanding of metrics and financial ops, with the ability to lead all aspects of accounting, financial reporting, and compliance.
* **Financial Control Excellence:** 
 Ability to execute fast and accurate month ends, high quality reporting, including complex accruals and can deal with complexities of cross-border entities (e.g legal set up, payroll, tax structuring)
* **Operational Efficiency:** 
 Experience automating finance functions for increased efficiency, speed, and accuracy, as well as managing vendor relationships to optimise terms, service levels and expenditure.
* **Communication Skills:** 
 Proven ability to foster relationships across the organization, strong communication and presentation skills.



  





**About Zendr** 




 Zendr is a fast-growing technology company headquartered in Stockholm, founded in 2020 by co-founders Johan Sund and Mathias Rebane. Zendr offers a user-friendly, B2B transportation administration platform enabling customers to compare rates, book freight as well as manage and track shipments, targeting SMEs with complex shipping needs across all industries. The platform currently serves approximately 2,000+ businesses (sector agnostic), including prominent brands such as Halberg-Rassy, Swedish Agro, and BJÖRN BORG. The company has grown to operate in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark with an operational team of 60+ employees.
 



 The platform is an all-in-one offering with flexible freight solutions through pre-negotiated freight rates with leading carriers, regardless of shipment type or destination, combined with in-house customer service supporting complex freight queries. This enables customers to compare rates, book, track, and manage all shipments within a single, automated system, designed to reduce operational complexity and costs. It features API integrations with key ERP and e-commerce systems to help teams access logistics data and automate shipping workflows, as well as an in-house developed proprietary cloud-platform, reducing the complexity of business logistics by simplifying and automating shipments, saving time and reducing costs for customers.
 



  





 Following years of rapid, profitable growth, Zendr is entering its next phase of expansion through a new strategic partnership with a European Private Equity investor, providing significant capital and expertise to accelerate Zendr’s clear technology advantage and execute their next phase of growth.
 



 The new Head of Finance and Accounting will be a key member of the finance leadership team reporting to the CFO, Paul Kirchmeier, with end-to-end responsibility for accounting and financial operations such as day-to-day control, monthly closings, management reporting.The role will also play a central part in building a scalable finance infrastructure - spanning systems, processes and controls - to support Zendr’s expansion into a European champion.
 



  





**Our hiring process** 




 We respect your time and aim to make the recruitment journey fast, transparent and enjoyable:
 


* Application review – We’ll review your application promptly and get back to you within a few days.
* Screening interview - An informal video call to learn more about you and share who we are.
* Practical test - A practical task you'll receive in order for us to understand your expertise better.
* On-site interview - An interview where you'd come to the office and get a better understanding of the role and Zendrs journey ahead.
* Final meeting - Meet the team, talk through the role in detail, and see if we’re the right fit for each other.



 From first contact to final decision, you can expect clear communication, timely feedback, and respect for your time - because great talent deserves a great candidate experience.
 



  





**Additional information** 




 We review applications on a rolling basis, which means the position may be filled before the closing date. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process you're more then welcome to contact Ellen Plym via ellen.plym@zendr.se
 



 Start date: As soon as possible
 



 Scope: Full-time, permanent position
 



 Location: Stockholm, Solna

title: Policy & Advocacy Leads, Nordics (6-Month Contract, Part-Time 3 Days/Week)
description:
Policy & Advocacy Lead, Nordics (6-Month Contract, Part-Time 3 Days/Week)
   

  

**About Global Citizen**
 Global Citizen is a movement of engaged citizens who are using their collective voice to end extreme poverty. On our platform, Global Citizens learn about the systemic causes of extreme poverty, take action on these issues, and earn rewards for their actions as part of a global community committed to lasting change. Global Citizens have taken over 42.9 million actions since 2009. Today, these actions, in combination with high-level advocacy work, have led to over $49 billion being distributed to our partners around the world, impacting 1.3 billion lives in the fight to end extreme poverty.
   

  

 Contract Overview
   

  

 Nordic countries have a strong tradition of providing Official Development Assistance (ODA) and are known for their high levels of commitment to international development. They consistently rank among the top countries in terms of ODA as a percentage of their GNI, with Sweden, Denmark, and Norway having historically met or exceeded the 0.7% target set by the United Nations. Yet, in the wake of recent global crises, cuts to Official Development Assistance (ODA) have become a focal point of concern, particularly in Nordic countries, driven by changes to political priorities and lack or weakening of government leadership. Despite the urgent need for international cooperation and support in the face of challenges such as the pandemic, climate change, and humanitarian emergencies, there has been a disconcerting trend of diminishing financial commitments to ODA.
   

  

 Global Citizen is seeking a part-time Policy and Advocacy lead for a six-month contract (with any potential renewal subject to the organization's discretion). This opportunity will be based in Stockholm with a flexibility of travelling to Oslo and Copenhagen to support Global Citizen’s ODA advocacy campaigns, with a particular focus on global health, and related campaign and events in Europe and globally, including Global Citizen Festivals, thought leadership convenings, and other tentpole moments.
   

  

 Global Citizen will leverage its “pop meets policy'' advocacy model to create impact. This contractor will be responsible for supporting the execution of global, regional and country specific campaigns consisting of short term and long term goals. This may consist of digital campaigns, offline activations, thought leadership convenings and mass scale policy and live music events. This contractor will be responsible for educating local and regional audiences on the importance of health equity and put pressure on key policy decision makers to deliver on policy objectives to include strengthening local systems and capacities.
   

  

 Scope of Work
   

  

 The policy & advocacy lead for Nordics will be responsible for:
   

  

* Leading, supporting the design, development, and day-to-day management of a key policy and advocacy grant-funded, multi-year health and development financing campaign. This opportunity focuses on ODA-related advocacy, with a particular focus on global health, and related campaigns and events in Europe and globally to include: Reform of the global financial system, EU MFF campaign, Global Citizen Festivals, thought leadership convenings, and other tentpole moments.
* Grant management: Develop project plans, allocate resources, and track progress against established goals. Provide day-to-day oversight on health grant activities and, where appropriate, connect deliverables across GC’s broader grant portfolio in Europe.
* Donor relations: leads stewardship and cultivation of current and prospective financing, health equity and adjacent sector donors to scale GC’s impact within the region.
* Interface with governments, private sector, NGOs and internal stakeholders to advance advocacy, report back on commitments made as part of Global Citizen advocacy campaigns and tentpole moments i.e impact reporting.
* Support the digital campaigns and content teams to develop actions and content specifically crafted for Nordic countries.
* Relationship management: Organize and drive the agenda and preparation for meetings with grant sponsors and other relevant stakeholders. Manage meetings, and handle correspondence with key stakeholders.
* Supporting and advising the GPA team on managing day-to-day operations and priorities with the grantor.
* Development of policy memos, conducting research and analysis to drive policy formulation and advocacy campaign design
* Ensure effective communication, coordination and managing workflow across the global policy team, Finance, Comms & marketing, Broadcast and production and growth teams as it concerns policy and advocacy priorities related to the Norcids.
* Event management: organize at smaller events in the Nordics with key stakeholders to advance Global Citizen’s priorities


**Additional Responsibilities**
 Additional responsibilities may include developing briefs and talking points on policy issues aligned with Global Citizen's broader global advocacy objectives, and overseeing policy projects, ensuring timely delivery of goals, especially within the European context.
   

  

 The ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a matrixed organization is key. This contractor opportunity will collaborate closely with the broader Global Policy and Advocacy team, interface with governments and stakeholders, and report on campaign commitments. Expertise in project management, data management, and excellent communication skills will contribute to the impactful work of Global Citizen in defeating poverty, defending the planet, and demanding equity.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Bachelors/ Masters Degree in development, economics, public health, international relations, or related fields.
* 4-7 years of Knowledge and experience with non-governmental organizations, governments, social impact, international institutions, United Nations agencies, and/ or non-profit organizations required
* Previous experience with policy work on development finance and related issues (climate finance, reform of the global financial system, taxation)
* Experience with project management
* Experience with data management, monitoring, and evaluation
* Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
* Excellent organizational skills
* Attention to detail and follow-through
* Ability to manage projects with professionalism and discretion
* Capacity to work under pressure and meet deadlines
* Proficient in English and Swedish. Additional languages would be an advantage
* Highly proficient in MS Office, Excel, Google Suite, Salesforce
* Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team


 More Details
   

  

* Must be authorized for employment in Sweden


 Global Citizen is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. Global Citizen strictly prohibits and does not tolerate discrimination against employees, applicants, or any other covered persons because of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, citizenship or any other protected classification under applicable federal, state, or local laws. In addition, Global Citizen complies with the relevant country laws governing employment nondiscrimination in all our international offices. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: Fullstack-utvecklare Java
description:

 Avega är ett konsultföretag i digital transformation och innovation som söker en erfaren fullstack java-utvecklare i Stockholm som vill ha direkt möjlighet att göra skillnad.

* Tio års arbetserfarenhet inom programmering i Java eller Kotlin
* Arbetserfarenhet med mikrotjänster baserade på Kubernetes eller Kafka
* Kafka för meddelandehantering
* Erfarenhet av molnlösningar från Azure, AWS eller GCP

* Erfarenhet av att jobba på ett agilt arbetsätt

 Självklart lägger vi stor vikt på personliga egenskaper och tror att du likt oss vill ha roligt tillsammans och har ett genuint intresse för systemutveckling. Vi tror att du brinner för problemlösning, är strukturerad och nyfiken.

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: LCA Specialist
description:
*Studies show that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. At Stegra, we’re building an impact-driven, sustainable company - and we need a diverse, inclusive team to make it happen.*
*If you share our passion but don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the perfect fit for this role, or another as we grow*
**LCA Specialist
   

  

 Temporary Parental Leave Cover - 1st April 2026 – 31st January 2027.**
 This role offers an excellent opportunity to apply your expertise in environmental sustainability and make a meaningful contribution to our team.
   

  

 As our Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) Specialist, you will play a central role in developing Product Carbon Footprint (PCF) models and LCAs for Stegra’s current and future hydrogen, iron, and steel products, based on customer needs.
   

  

 As part of our group sustainability team, you will apply data-driven and analytical approaches to address environmental impacts across the value chain. In this role, you will strengthen Stegra’s LCA and PCF capabilities by developing tools, collecting and analyzing data, presenting findings, and supporting projects across the organization.
   

  

 You will also contribute to digital solutions that improve these processes, deliver accurate customer reporting, and produce Environmental Product Declarations (EPDs) for our product portfolio. Finally, you will support the implementation of processes for monitoring and reporting greenhouse gas emissions in line with the EU Emissions Trading System (EU ETS). As a member of the sustainability team, you will also participate in initiatives and projects initiated by the team to drive Stegra’s sustainability agenda and deliver on our promises, as well as providing guidance and expertise to other teams across the company, especially our commercial and product sustainability team.
   

  

 This role offers a unique opportunity to join a company with no legacy; where you will have the possibility to shape the future of environmental modelling. You will report to our Head of Group Sustainability and belong to the Business Development function. You will engage cross-functionally with key stakeholders to ensure sustainability is at the core of our business to build a profitable impact company.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Set up, manage, and develop LCAs and PCF models for current and future hydrogen, iron, and steel products.
* Provide the organization with expertise and guidance in environmental sustainability for our Boden project and other emerging projects.
* Support in the development of Stegra’s Corporate Carbon Footprint.
* Assisting in maintaining the EU ETS Monitoring Plan
* Participate in selected and prioritized sustainability related projects, for instance related to customer experience.
* Compile data, perform in-depth analysis and effectively present findings to support decision- making.


**Qualifications:**
* M.Sc. in relevant field such as Sustainability, Environmental Engineering, Mechanical


 Engineering, Energy Engineering or similar.
   

  

* Minimum of 2 years’ relevant experience in Life Cycle Assessment (LCA), preferably within industrial applications; experience in the steel sector is a strong advantage.
* Strong analytical skills with deep understanding within the key elements of Life Cycle


 Assessments and Product Carbon Footprint modelling.
   

  

* Familiarity with relevant standards such as ISO 14040, ISO 14044, ISO 14067, GHG Protocol and EN 15804.
* Knowledge of EU climate regulations, carbon accounting, or emissions monitoring is an


 advantage.
   

  

* Proficient in relevant LCA softwares such as SimaPro and LCA databases such as Ecoinvent, MS Office suite and a general ability to use digital tools. Demonstrable experience in programming languages such as python is a plus but not required.
* Ability to communicate and present results clearly and effectively.
* Excellent skills in written and spoken English; knowledge of Swedish is an advantage.
* Comfortable dealing with ambiguity, with a passion to learn and grow.


**What We Can Offer You**
 If you are passionate about making actual change and having a positive impact on society and our planet, Stegra offers a unique opportunity to be part of a fun and professional team with high ambitions.
   

  

**Benefits At Stegra**
 At Stegra, you’ll join a company where your work has real impact on the climate, the industry, and future generations. We’re building a culture rooted in safety, trust, and inclusion, where people feel supported to grow and thrive.
   

  

 You’ll receive fair, competitive compensation aligned with collective agreements, along with benefits like up to 30 days of paid vacation, occupational pension, parental benefits, and insurance. If you need support with relocation or immigration, our relocation department will help guide you through the process, whether it’s permits, housing or other practical matters. You can also enjoy perks like subsidized gym memberships and bike leases, plus the everyday benefits of life closer to nature.
   

  

**Read More About Benefits At Stegra Here.**
**This is Stegra**
 Stegra is on a mission to change the global steel industry by producing green hydrogen, iron, and steel - with the goal of eliminating CO₂ emissions. Instead of coal, we use green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity, meaning our primary emissions will be water and heat.
   

  

 By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitized, and sustainable plant in Boden, Northern Sweden - currently under construction. But this is just the beginning. Our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize industries beyond steel, paving the way for a cleaner future.
   

  

**Our Stockholm Office**
 Our modern Stockholm office is located on Norra Stationsgatan, close to Karolinska University Hospital in central Stockholm. Here, you’ll find a bright, collaborative workspace where cross-functional teams connect, share ideas, and drive progress. Whether you're visiting regularly or working hybrid, you'll be part of a vibrant office culture with easy access to the city’s energy and amenities.
   

  

*Founded in 2020, Stegra (formerly H2 Green Steel) was created with the purpose to decarbonize hard-to-abate industry. Construction of our first project – an integrated plant producing green hydrogen, green iron and green steel – is well underway in Boden, Sweden. Slashing emissions using green hydrogen and renewable electricity, we’re starting a clean industrial revolution. Steel is just the beginning.
   

  

 We are building a diverse and rapidly growing team spread across our site and offices in Boden and Stockholm, targeting close to 1500 employees by the end of 2025. Together, we focus on delivering green impact – for our people, customers, investors, society and planet.*

title: Postdoc in conversational social robotics
description:
**Job Description**
 We are seeking a postdoctoral researcher for a research project in conversational social robotics. The project aims to develop computational models for spoken interaction with applications in human–robot interaction. A particular focus is on the use of multimodal large language models (audio, text, and vision) that can take into account both what is being said and the situational context in which the interaction takes place. A central research challenge is to model and manage conversations involving multiple participants.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Requirements**
* A doctoral degree or an equivalent foreign degree. This eligibility requirement must be met no later than the time the employment decision is made.
* Applicants should have a PhD degree in a subject relevant for the research, such as computer science, speech technology, computational linguistics, or cognitive science.
* The position requires good skills in programming, machine learning, and statistical analysis.
* Good command of English, in writing and speaking, is a prerequisite for presenting research results in international periodicals and at conferences.
* We also expect applicants to have a deep interest in spoken language interaction, and to have done their PhD in a related area.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* A doctoral degree or an equivalent foreign degree, obtained within the last three years prior to the application deadline
* We would like to see that you have experience of formulating research ideas independently from your supervisor and getting them implemented. At the same time, experience of doing research in collaboration with others is commendable.
* You should also be aware of diversity and equal opportunity issues


 Great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.
   

  

 Join us at KTH
   

  

 KTH shapes the future through education, research and innovation. As a leading international technical university, we play an active role in advancing the transition towards a sustainable society. At KTH, you have the opportunity to grow and develop in a creative and dynamic environment, with good working conditions and attractive benefits. Equality, diversity and equal opportunities are essential to quality and form an integral part of KTH’s core values as a university and public authority.
   

  

 Learn more about our benefits and what it's like to work and grow at KTH.
   

  

 Trade union representatives
   

  

 Contact information to trade union representatives.
   

  

 To apply for the position
   

  

 Log into KTH's recruitment system to apply for this position. You are responsible for ensuring that your application is complete according to the instructions in the ad.
   

  

 The application must include:
   

  

* CV including relevant professional experience and knowledge.
* Copy of diplomas and grades from your previous university studies. Translations into English or Swedish if the original documents have not been issued in any of these languages.
* Brief account of why you want to conduct research, your academic interests and how they relate to your previous studies and future goals. Maximally two pages long.


 Your complete application must be received at KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

**About The Employment**
 The position offered is for, at the most, two years.
   

  

 A position as a postdoctoral fellow is a time-limited qualified appointment focusing mainly on research, intended as a first career step after a dissertation.
   

  

 Others
   

  

 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.
   

  

 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
   

  

 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
   

  

 Disclaimer: In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence.

title: Nordic Consulting Resource Manager | Consulting | Stockholm
description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.
   

  

 We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.
   

  

 Join EY and help to build a better working world.
   

  

**The opportunity**
 We are looking for a Nordic Consulting Resource Manager to help enable high performing teams and support the growth of our Consulting practice. In this role, you act as a strategic advisor—connecting people, skills and opportunities while driving efficiency, utilization and high-quality delivery. The position is based in EY’s Stockholm office and supports our Financial Services Consulting practice.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
 As a Nordic Consulting Resource Manager, focused on the Financial Services Industry, you will act as an unbiased advocate for effective staffing across the Nordics, working closely with business leaders, Client Account Teams and delivery teams to understand demand, market activity and upcoming opportunities. You will stay informed through active participation in relevant meetings. Your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Collaborating with the business to understand staffing needs and upcoming engagements.
* Staying updated on sales pipelines and supporting staffing for bids and pursuits.
* Owning the end-to-end staffing process by responding quickly, asking, clarifying questions and challenging when needed.
* Presenting well-vetted candidates and clearly explaining selection rationale.
* Partnering with onshore, nearshore and offshore teams to identify the best resources.
* Managing expectations and maintaining clear, timely communication throughout.
* Maintaining a strong virtual and on‑site presence across the Nordics.
* Getting to know consultants to understand their skills, availability and development goals.
* Meeting all new hires within their first two weeks.
* Staying current on utilization, forecasting and capacity metrics to support optimal allocation.


**Qualifications**
**Skills and attributes for success**
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Human Resources, Consulting or a related field.
* Experience in resource management, consulting operations or talent management within professional services.
* Familiarity with tools such as ProFinda and workforce reporting platforms.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to ask clarifying questions and present ideas clearly.
* Analytical ability to interpret utilization, capacity and forecast data.
* High digital literacy and comfort with dashboards and AI-enabled tools.


**Meritorious**
* Experience with consulting solution areas or delivery teams.
* Understanding of sales cycles and pursuit processes.
* Experience working across Nordic or multi-country environments.


**As a person you are**
* A trusted advisor who can constructively challenge and collaborate with business leaders.
* Responsive, proactive and comfortable managing multiple priorities.
* Adaptable and confident in a dynamic environment.
* Curious, eager to learn and committed to continuous development.
* Team-oriented and supportive, fostering a “one team” mindset.


**What We Offer You**
 At EY, we’ll help you develop future-focused leadership skills and provide world-class experiences. You’ll work in a flexible, inclusive environment with globally connected teams. Learn more at https://www.ey.com/en\_gl/careers.
   

  

**Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.**
 Please submit your application no later than
 **28th of February 2026** 
 . If you have questions about the role, please contact
 **Nick Leitheiser** 
 at Nick.Leitheiser@dk.ey.com. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact
 **Adrian Lyng** 
 at Adrian.Lyng@se.ey.com.
 *Please note that a background check will be conducted as part of the recruitment process.*
 At EY, we celebrate diversity and encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds. If you have any questions, require assistance, or need adjustments to the recruitment process due to a disability, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at recruitmentsweden@se.ey.com. We are here to support you.
   

  

**EY | Building a better working world**
 EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.
   

  

 EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

title: Senior systemutvecklare till statliga e-legitimationen
description:
Vill du bygga framtidens statliga digitala identitet för hela Sverige? Vi söker dig som inte bara skriver kod, utan som också vill forma lösningar som gör verklig skillnad för användaren.
   

  

 Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

 Nu söker sektionen Persondokument en senior systemutvecklare som vill vara med och utveckla den nya statliga e-legitimationen – ett av Sveriges viktigaste digitala samhällssystem.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar du med en digital identitet på högsta tillitsnivå, där säkerhet, användarvänlighet och tillgänglighet står i centrum. Du blir en nyckelperson i ett team som står inför avgörande tekniska och strategiska vägval, och där din kunskap får verklig påverkan på system, arkitektur och i förlängningen på miljontals användare.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om uppdragen
   

  

 Du utgår från moderna lokaler på Kungsholmen i Stockholm, med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till två dagar i veckan. Som statligt anställd på Polismyndigheten erbjuds du trygga och särskilda förmåner kring pension, föräldralön, friskvård m.m.
   

  

 Läs mer om våra förmåner och villkor här
   

  

*Sektionen söker även systemutvecklare till system för resehandlingar*
 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 I rollen som senior systemutvecklare tar du ett tydligt ansvar för att driva och vidareutveckla våra system med användarnas behov och verksamhetens mål i fokus. Du är med och leder det tekniska utvecklingsarbetet över tid, från design och arkitektur till implementation och förvaltning, och bidrar aktivt till att lösningarna är robusta, skalbara och säkra. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med ett tvärfunktionellt team bestående av andra systemutvecklare, specialister och kompetenta kollegor från olika delar av verksamheten och IT-avdelningen, där ni gemensamt fattar tekniska beslut och arbetar mot uppsatta mål.
   

  

**Om uppdraget:**
* Fokus på att bygga och modernisera lösningar för den nya statliga e-legitimationen
* Förvaltning och anpassning av befintliga system utifrån nya behov, förordningar och lagkrav
* Arbete i en modern teknisk plattform med:
* Mikrotjänstarkitektur
* Containerbaserade lösningar
* Automatiserade distributionsflöden
* Stort fokus på kvalitet, säkerhet och långsiktig hållbarhet
* Möjlighet att ta ett tydligt tekniskt ledarskap och bidra till systemarkitektur samt agera tekniskt bollplank i teamet


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:
   

  

* Utbildning inom system/datavetenskap alternativt motsvarande förvärvad erfarenhet som Polismyndigheten bedömer som likvärdig
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom Java på Linuxplattform
* Flerårig erfarenhet av Spring Boot och relaterade ramverk
* Flerårig erfarenhet av mikrotjänstarkitektur och containerbaserad miljö (tex Docker, Kubernetes)
* Goda kunskaper i svenska
* Svenskt medborgarskap


**Det är meriterande om du även har:**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i roller med tekniskt ledarskap (tex Tech lead/Lead developer)
* Implementerat säkerhetslösningar tidigare baserat på OIDC/OAuth2.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD på Jenkins, till exempel med verktyg/plattformar såsom Bitbucket, Nexus, Openshift, Kubernetes, Docker, Gitops och Maven


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi värdesätter att du som person motiveras av att stötta och bidra till Polismyndighetens samhällsviktiga uppdrag och utvecklas både i din yrkesroll och som lagspelare. Du trivs i en miljö där kunskapsdelning och gemensam utveckling är en naturlig del av arbetet – samtidigt som vi har det roligt tillsammans.
   

  

 Rollen innebär många kontaktytor, vilket ställer krav på god
 **samarbets- och kommunikativ** 
 förmåga. Du anpassar din kommunikation efter målgrupp och sammanhang, både i muntligt och skriftligt. Arbetet kräver även att du kan arbeta
 **självständigt** 
 , tar egna
 **initiativ** 
 och har ett
 **lösningsorienterat** 
 förhållningssätt. Vi ser även att du inte tvekar att stiga fram och ta en ledande roll när situationen kräver det, till exempel genom att driva frågor, fatta tekniska ställningstaganden och stödja andra i arbetet.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter dina personliga egenskaper högt och kommer lägga stor vikt vid dessa för att hitta rätt person för rollen.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Har du frågor om uppdraget är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

 Rekryterande chef: 010-5636614
   

  

 Har du frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:
   

  

 Ansvarig HR-konsult: Ilknur Kaya Göker, ilknur.kaya-goker@polisen.se
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Polisförbundet, Sofia Ask, tfn: 010-563 87 10
   

  

 Saco-S, nås via mejl saco-s.avdelningarna@polisen.se
   

  

 SEKO Polisen, Karna Tillheden, tfn: 010-561 66 27
   

  

 ST, Jessica Stålenkrans 010-563 32 66
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, 6 månaders provanställning
   

  

 Anställningsbenämning: Handläggare
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Arbetstid: Flextid
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Funktion: Systemutvecklare
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna i ditt ansökningsmejl. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Det är därför viktigt att du svarar tydligt och utförligt på frågorna och inte hänvisar till andra handlingar t.ex. CV.
   

  

**Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett. Arbetsprov kan förekomma som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.**
 Besvara följande urvalsfrågor som en del av din ansökan.
   

  

* Har du en utbildning inom systemvetenskap alternativt motsvarade förvärvad erfarenhet? Vänligen utveckla ditt svar.
* Har du flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom Java på Linuxplattform? Har du erfarenhet av Spring Boot och relaterade ramverk? Vänligen utveckla ditt svar.
* Har du god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska? (Ja/Nej)
* Har du svenskt medborgarskap? (Ja/Nej)
* Har du erfarenhet av tekniskt ledarskap eller att ha arbetat i arkitekturroller (t.ex. som Tech Lead)? Vänligen utveckla ditt svar.
* Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med att implementera säkerhetslösningar tidigare baserade på OpenID/OAuth2? Vänligen utveckla ditt svar.
* Har du erfarenhet av CI/CD på Jenkins, till exempel med verktyg/plattformar såsom Bitbucket, Nexus, Openshift, Kubernetes, Docker, Gitops och Maven? Vänligen utveckla ditt svar


 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och svar på urvalsfrågor via e-post till jobb.na@polisen.se senast den 23 februari 2026. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen.
 **Märk din ansökan med referensnummer** 
**A054.091/2026** 
**i mailets ärendemening.**
 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning under https://polisen.se/krigsplacering och https://polisen.se/sakerhetsprovning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering
   

  

 Din ansökan är en allmän handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi undanber oss samtal och mejl från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Vi söker konsulter inom Marin Teknik!
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Är du ingenjör och har en bakgrund inom marinen eller sjöfartsområdet? Då är det dig vi söker!
   

  

 CGI levererar IT-tjänster och produkter till en rad olika aktörer på marknaden, både privata och offentliga.
   

  

 På grund utav omvärldsläget och satsningar inom försvaret de senaste åren har efterfrågan på kompetens inom sjöfart och marin teknik ökat enormt. Därför söker vi just nu duktiga och engagerade konsulter inom marin teknik till vårt affärsområde CGI Public & Defense!
   

  

 Enheten marinteknik är en del av CGI:s försvarsgren. Vi stödjer Försvarsmakten, FMV och försvarsindustrin med utveckling och vidmakthållande av tekniska system och marinens fartyg. Vi har kunskaper om och erfarenhet av processer kring anskaffning och utveckling av system utifrån ett livscykelperspektiv (Life Cycle Management). Vi arbetar med både juniora och seniora konsulter i team och självständigt.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Vi har mångårig erfarenhet inom en rad olika områden inom försvaret, vi tror att du kommer kunna bidra med expertis inom något av följande områden
   

  

* Integrerat logistikstöd ILS (Integrerat Logistikstöd) omfattar driftsäkerhet, tillförlitlighet, underhållsanalys och underhållsberedning. ILS är en del av systemutvecklingsarbetet och förvaltningen avseende underhållsmässighet, underhållssäkerhet, funktionssäkerhet och användarvänlighet under hela livscykeln.
* Systemarbete Vi stödjer kunder med systemarbete avseende design, integration och hantering av komplexa system under deras livscykler. Vi bistår med kompetenser för komplexa system inom flera områden, exempelvis försvar och IT.
* Kravarbete och verifiering Vi har mångårig erfarenhet av procedurframtagning FAT, ICO, HAT, SAT med metoderna dokumentgranskning, inspektion och test. Vi har fördjupande kunskaper inom: verifieringsledning, kravnedbrytning, kravframtagning, säkerställa prestanda mot kravspecifikationen, kontrollera att krav är uppfyllda och genomförda och restpunktshantering.
* Projektledning Projektledning för oss på CGI handlar om att kunna leverera kravhantering, planering, restpunktshantering, riskhantering, budgetering och uppföljning. Vi har mångårig erfarenhet från både stora och små projekt samt delprojekt. Vi erfarenhet från utvecklingsprojekt och integrationsprojekt både inom det marina området och inom IT området. Vi har mångårig erfarenhet inom: projektledning (PMI/IPMA), projektstöd, projektplanering/koordinering, konfigurationsledning, verksamhetsutveckling och test och verifiering.
* Förvaltning och produktledning Vi har gedigen erfarenhet av vidmakthållande/förvaltning av marina system avseende: end of life hantering, driftuppföljning, avvikelsehantering, modifieringar och ombyggnationer, konfigurationshantering, tillämpat underhåll, ILS (Integrerat logistikstöd), produktutveckling och projektkoordinering.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vill du bidra med din expertis? Kom i kontakt med någon av våra experter!
   

  

 Daniel Isberg - Daniel.Isberg@cgi.com - Konsultchef
   

  

 Frederic Von Arnold - frederic.vonarnold@cgi.com - Senior konsultexpert
   

  

 Albin Renlund - albin.renlund@cgi.com - Rekryteringsspecialist.
   

  

 Urval av kvalifikationer sker löpande men bedöms utifrån ovan nämnda områden.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Sales Manager Midmarket
description:
**This is what makes the position as Sales Manager fun**
* Play a leadership role in one of Dustin’s most important transformation and growth journeys, with real influence on strategy, ways of working, and long-term success
* Combine strategic leadership with hands-on business impact by owning full budget responsibility while actively developing customers and driving results through your team
* Lead and shape a high-performing Midmarket sales team in a collaborative, transparent culture built on trust, accountability, and winning together


**My name is Peter Theorell. I am the Sales Director Sweden Commercial** 
 . As a leader, I am present, clear, and trusting, giving my team freedom under responsibility while actively supporting their development and helping each individual reach their full potential.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Sales Manager**
**Responsibility:** 
 You will be given responsibility for leading, developing, and driving results through a team of Account Managers, while actively contributing to Dustin’s strategic goals, transformation initiatives, and long-term customer development in the Commercial Midmarket segment.
   

  

**Collaboration:** 
 Together with your team, you take care of achieving ambitious sales targets and driving customer growth. You’ll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with Marketing and Operations to ensure strong collaboration and seamless execution.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Lead, coach, and develop a team of Account Managers to achieve and exceed business and budget targets
* Drive active customer and business development through strategic account management and hands-on sales support
* Implement strategic initiatives and continuous improvements to enhance team performance, processes, and customer engagement


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us. Curious? Our Life at Dustin - Dustin Sweden page has you covered.
   

  

**For This Role Specific You Can Expect**
 A bonus paid out every quarter
   

  

 You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.
   

  

**This Is What We Imagine You Bring**
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who combines strong business acumen with a people-focused leadership style, inspiring your team to achieve outstanding results while embracing change and growth.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That**
* You are results- and goal-oriented with a clear business mindset
* You are structured, independent, and resilient under pressure
* You create engagement and motivation within your team, putting collective success first
* You have a bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* Experience with leading and coaching B2B sales teams, driving complex sales, and managing budget and performance follow-up
* Technical skills: proficiency in CRM tools, structured sales methodologies (e.g., Challenger Sales), and fluency in Swedish and English


 What can you expect next?
   

  

 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with TA partner Ida Wannebro
* 1st interview with Petet Theorell Director Commercial
* Assessment (Personality- and cognitive thinking test)
* 2nd interview with Peter and someone from the team


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Ida Wannebro via e-mail: ida.wannebro@dustin.com
   

  

**We will start reviewing applications and moving forward in the recruitment process in mid-January. Thank you for your patience, and we look forward to connecting then.**

title: Specialist inom säkerhetsskydd
description:
**Vill du vara med och bidra till ett säkrare samhälle?** 




 För över femton år sedan startade Basalt med en enkel men avgörande idé att stärka Sveriges motståndskraft. Idag är vi ett av landets ledande produkt- och konsultbolag inom verksamhets och säkerhetsskydd och vi fortsätter växa. Samtidigt är vi ett stabilt och välmående bolag som värnar om vår familjära kultur och om medarbetarnas välbefinnande. Hos oss får du anställningstrygghet, respekt, konkurrenskraftig pension och förmåner samt en balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi prioriterar lärande och utveckling och du får möjlighet att göra verklig skillnad och samtidigt må bra.
 



  





 På Basalt utvecklar vi marknadens säkraste it-plattform Craton och stöttar samhällsviktiga aktörer i att skydda sina mest värdefulla tillgångar mot både yttre och inre hot. Genom våra lösningar bidrar vi till att hålla igång de verksamheter som får samhället att fungera även vid stora störningar eller kriser. Här får du arbeta med teknik som gör konkret skillnad och ingå i ett team som drivs av innovation, kvalitet och ett tydligt syfte.
 



  





 Nu befinner vi oss i en stark tillväxtfas och söker dig som vill arbeta som konsult inom säkerhetsskydd.
 



  





**Nu behöver vi bli fler som vill göra skillnad** 




 Hos oss får du arbeta med engagerade kollegor som kombinerar hög teknisk kompetens med ett genuint engagemang för samhällets säkerhet. Vi tror på att vara både vassa och snälla, vi levererar på högsta nivå, men bryr oss alltid om varandra.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Vi söker dig som vill arbeta i en omväxlande konsultroll där du får bistå kunder inom systematiskt säkerhetsskydd. Hos oss kommer du:
 



  




* Arbeta som konsult inom säkerhetsskydd och bistå kunder med systematiskt säkerhetsskyddsarbete.
* Ingå i ett team med både seniora och juniora konsulter för uppdrag hos kunder.
* Möjlighet till uppdrag inom samhällskritisk verksamhet och vidareutveckling inom olika specialistområden.



  





 Som konsult rapporterar du till vår konsultgruppschef och får möjlighet att bidra till samhällskritiska uppdrag, samtidigt som du får chansen att vidareutvecklas inom våra specialistområden.
 



  





**Din bakgrund** 




 Vi söker dig som har omfattande erfarenhet av:
 


* Styrkt erfarenhet av operativt och strategiskt säkerhetsskydd. Såsom upprättande och implementering av säkerhetsskyddsanalyser och säkerhetsskyddsåtgärder.
* Dokumenterad kunskap om relevanta regelverk såsom säkerhetsskyddslagen,, ISO/IEC 27000-serien, NIS-direktivet och GDPR.
* Relevant utbildning inom säkerhetsskydd, personalsäkerhet, eller motsvarande.



  





 Det är meriterande med:
 


* Erfarenhet av att implementera ledningssystem och uppnå certifiering, ex. ISO 27001.
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsskyddsarbete från myndigheter och privata aktörer.
* Utbildning/certifiering som säkerhetsskyddschef eller likande.
* Tidigare erfarenhet som konsult.



  





 Våra kunder har höga krav på dokumentation så du behöver vara van att dokumentera och rapportera ditt arbete, på svenska och/eller engelska.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till Basalt och vårt team!
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 För att ge dig trygghet och stabilitet erbjuder vi ett förmånspaket som inkluderar en av marknadens bästa pensionslösningar, omfattande försäkringar, förstärkt föräldralön och ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr/år. Du får även tillgång till Benifex, där du kan hitta extra förmåner och vi erbjuder kontinuerliga möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Vi erbjuder också tjänstledighet med löneutfyllnad för medarbetare som tjänstgör inom Försvarsmakten, inklusive GSS/T, reservofficerare och hemvärnssoldater.
 



  





 Vi värnar om balansen mellan arbete och fritid. Med flexibla arbetstider, 5-timmars arbetsdag innan helgdagar och ledigt på klämdagar ser vi till att du har tid för både ditt jobb och ditt privatliv. Dessutom anordnar vi gemensamma aktiviteter, såsom skidresor, träningspass samt sociala luncher och frukostar, för att stärka sammanhållningen och göra arbetsplatsen ännu trevligare.
 



  





 Vi strävar efter att du ska känna stolthet och trivsel hos oss på Basalt. Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och om hur det är att arbeta på Basalt
 
 här!
 




  





**Placering** 




 Vi har två kontor placerade i centrala Stockholm och i Enköping. Denna roll är placerad i Stockholm men utförs främst hos våra kunder.
 



  





**Din ansökan** 




 Ansök med ditt CV och beskriv kort vad du söker i din nästa roll. Vi gör löpande urval och intervjuer så ansök gärna redan idag! Har du frågor? Hör gärna av dig till Hanna.stockelid@basalt.se
 



  





**Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande. Eftersom våra kunders verksamhet kräver det och flera av våra anställda är placerade i säkerhetsklass, är svenskt medborgarskap ett villkor för tjänsten.** 




  





**Basalt i korthet:** 



* Grundat 2009, idag ca 140 medarbetare
* Kontor i Stockholm och Enköping
* En del av Omegapoint Group
* Ledande inom säkra it-lösningar och systematiskt säkerhetsarbete
* Vision: att vara det självklara valet för ett robust och säkert samhälle



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Life Science Practice Leader Northern Region
description:
**Job Description**
**Life Science Practice Leader Northern Region**
**Role Purpose**
 The primary purpose of the role is the Leadership of the Northern Region Life Science Industry Practice. It is the ultimate underwriting leader within the region for Life Science. The leader is responsible for Life Science IP across all lines and to lead dedicated and non-dedicated underwriters.
   

  

 The Life Science Lead Northern Region is the Best Practice leader across the region.
   

  

 The successful candidate must demonstrate strong competency and experience in the following areas:
   

  

**Technical Underwriting Skills**
 The Lead will be expected to have strong experience in underwriting of Casualty, E&O, and Clinical Trials as they relate to Life Science companies, and have a broad understanding of Chubb’s appetite, preferred risks and wordings as well as those of key competitors. Ultimately, the role must be capable of holding high levels of underwriting authority and be comfortable taking referral work from the Northern Life Science team.
   

  

 The Lead should also have a good awareness of the underwriting appetite and processes for other target lines of business such as property, cyber, marine etc to drive cross-sell, and be closely connected to those leaders and communities.
   

  

**Planning & Execution**
 Prepare and execute a business plan for the Life Science Industry Practice with key actions and tactics. This should include market sizing / evaluation of the opportunity and product/solution development (build the product, proposition and consider appropriate distribution channels). Delivery and monitoring of the financial plan across all lines of business is a critical responsibility for this role, ensuring that rate, retention and new business numbers are planned and forecast accurately and that monthly production targets are met.
   

  

**Target Operating Models**
 Lead and actively support adherence to Chubb’s target operating models. This will require an understanding of the Operating Model that Chubb wishes to follow and pro-active execution to achieve the required outcome. Working with team members in the Madrid HUB and other stakeholders to ensure renewal business migrates effectively, where applicable. Knowledge and regular use of Chubb’s systems including but not limited to Jarvis, Ignite, PMR, QlikView and Insight therefore as a prerequisite. Drive and maintain best practice and disciplines around usage of key operational systems, such as Workview. Look for opportunities to continuously improve our processes to generate operational efficiency.
   

  

**People Management**
 There are direct and indirect reports to the role in a matrix environment of a team of underwriters across the Northern region. This role will set the vision and plan, support the day to day needs of the team, plus play an active part in supporting the talent and development needs of underwriters. Regular travel is required to cover the various countries in the Northern Region (i.e. Netherlands, Belgium, Sweden, Finland, Denmark and Norway) as well as to Spain (Madrid) where the Hub is located.
   

  

**Broker and market engagement**
 Understand the broker landscape for Life Science across the Northern region and directly support high value relationships and opportunities. Ensure focus around driving the pipeline of new business activity with underwriters and Distribution (both from short- and long-term perspective) to meet plan. Raise Chubb’s profile as a Life Science industry expert across all lines of business through marketing collateral and events, engagement with technical market bodies, plus speaking at client, broker, and industry forums/events.
   

  

 Closely work and engage with Broker management resources, CUO, country managers and segment leaders across both the Nordics and Benelux.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Underwriting Referral – act as the main referral point for underwriters on Life Science business.
* Multiline – Lead a multiline strategy with focus on cross-sell of additional lines to Life Science clients. Work with LoB leaders and champions to create a broader Life Science multiline community focused on working together to deliver multi line propositions for our Life Science clients.
* Delivering Plan – Prepare and execute a business plan for the Life Science Industry Practice with key actions and tactics. Delivering and exceeding the Life Science Industry Practice financial plan.
* Strategic focus - Working closely with Line Managers and the Region to formulate and deliver on an underwriting strategy. Ensuring quality control within defined area of responsibility by undertaking quantitative underwriting reviews, running regular management meetings. Supporting effective management of the portfolio.
* Procedures - Meet company standards in respect of policy documentation, contract certainty and compliance and regulatory requirements.
* Compliance – Closely work with the UoM on Peer review implementation across the practice and the completion of all audit requirements and actions within agreed timescales and adherence to all legal compliance standards.
* Leadership - Promoting Chubb as a ‘Go to’ market to brokers and clients. Acting as a senior representative for the Life Science Industry Practice (both internally and externally) for all lines of business, driving the strategic relationships, in terms of trading and execution with all our broking partners. Supporting and encouraging colleagues to drive the business. Responsible for the strategic and operational management of the team.
* Product Development - Developing and seeking out new opportunities to innovate within the Life Science Industry practice, working with other stakeholders (including other Product lines) to generate new ideas. Regularly conduct and share market research and intelligence. Identify and harness new opportunities.
* Training/People - Working with regional managers to ensure the provision of appropriate training and mentoring support in the team to support appropriate authority delegation. Support a robust succession planning is in place across the practice.
* Operational Management - Understanding, interpreting, and communicating to the team effectively the Strategic Priorities of the Practice.
