title: Network Design Engineer
description:
***Tele2 is building Sweden’s 5G Standalone future — want in?***
*We’re looking for a
 **Network Design Engineer** 
 to join our Mobile & Fixed Voice team and help shape the next generation of IMS and IoT services. You’ll design, build, troubleshoot, and drive some of the most critical systems in our mobile network — hands‑on, end‑to‑end.*
*If you love complex tech, real impact, and a team that actually collaborates, this is your chance to take a key role in Tele2’s 5G evolution.*
*Ready to help power the network of tomorrow? Let’s talk.*
**DCT**
 Are you ready to be at the forefront of digital innovation? Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial
   

  

 ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate.
   

  

 Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and frontend development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be a member of the Mobile Core department where we manage the Mobile & Fixed Voice Network in Sweden and international voice for Tele2 Group. We are also responsible for several Central platforms and the services they provide for the Tele2 Group.
   

  

 As a Network design Engineer Mobile Voice, you will participate in the Design and Engineering work for Tele2 Mobile Voice Services and Systems within the domain, ensuring that we deliver in line with our demands and with the best quality. You will work with the whole flow from requirements, development and implementation of new services, maintaining the system roadmaps and KPI’s, producing guidelines and training for operations. Within the role you will also be responsible for security/regulatory alignment and financial follow-ups and assessments.
   

  

 The other part of this role also includes you providing third-line support for our customers, ensuring that we deliver superior customer experience. You will work with Life Cycle Management of the network elements, maintain the systems' service level by means of KPI’s and act on alarms, as well as producing guidelines and training for operations.
   

  

 The role offers ample opportunities to interact with and manage vendors. You will be part of the engineering team which has responsibility for the Mobile Voice Core including IMS. Planning and performing capacity expansions based on monitoring performance metrics is an integral part of the work.
   

  

 The position is in our headquarter in Kista, Stockholm and we offer a hybrid workplace.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 To thrive and succeed in this role we believe that you...
   

  

* Have Education in telecommunications with Higher University degree (HBO/BEng) with a for the functional area relevant specialization and/or proven Engineering or Operations experience in a telecommunications industry environment, within the Mobile Voice domain and IMS VoLTE
* Good knowledge and experience of signaling protocols, SIP/MAP/Diameter/Camel/HTTP/SDP
* Good knowledge of IMS, Architecture, 3GPP standards etc.
* Good knowledge and experience of Linux
* Resident in Sweden


**Meriting Qualifications**
* System administration skills in Unix environment
* Experience from security/regulatory alignment
* Experience of monitoring/tracing tools like Polystar Osix, NetQPro,Prometheus, Grafana, Kibana, Wireshark etc
* Experience of Cloud Native Deployments (Container Network Functions), Kubernetes, OpenShift


 We are looking for an Engineer with the ability to lead development and evolve the Mobile & Fixed Voice Core. We think you are a committed team player showing enthusiasm and motivation thus influencing colleagues in a positive way. We think you are a person who is curious and who is always seeking to grow. You are a responsible person who is never afraid to ask for help and able to communicate very effectively with colleagues and vendors.

title: Solution Sales Expert
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we keep it simple: you bring your best to us, and we'll bring out the best in you. We're builders touching over 20 industries and 80% of global commerce, and we need your unique talents to help shape what's next. The work is challenging – but it matters. You'll find a place where you can be yourself, prioritize your wellbeing, and truly belong. What's in it for you? Constant learning, skill growth, great benefits, and a team that wants you to grow and succeed.
   

  

**Role Overview**
  

  

 The Solution Sales Executive (SSE) Expert is responsible for combining deep SAP expertise, business acumen, and end-to-end solution area domain knowledge to drive LoB cloud revenue, customer success, accelerate adoption of innovation (especially AI), and position the organization as a market leader. The SSE shapes transformative solutions and delivers measurable value to customers through thought leadership, innovation, and strategic execution—supporting both specific Lines of Business (LoB) and the overall “One SAP” strategy.
   

  

  

  

 This position will be responsible for selling our Public Cloud ERP suite.  Qualifications for the position will require a minimum of
 **12 years of experience** 
 to include subject matter expertise with a proven track record of
 **selling Public Cloud ERP over the most recent 4 plus years in multiple industries.**
**What You'll** 
 Do
   

  

  

  

* Account ownership & strategy: Serve as the designated Line-of-Business owner for assigned accounts, owning the end-to-end relationship and developing multi-year strategic account plans that align customer objectives with company goals and the broader account team’s direction.
* Drive the end-to-end customer value journey with domain expertise: Apply deep financial applications expertise to map current-state processes, identify high-impact gaps, and design a prioritized transformation roadmap that delivers measurable business value across the customer lifecycle.
* Pipeline & opportunity management: Proactively identify, qualify, and develop expansion opportunities within existing accounts, building a healthy pipeline, forecasting revenue, and coordinating with sales to convert opportunities into closed deals.
* Product success & innovation: Lead go-to-market efforts for new products and capabilities—engaging early with customers to validate concepts, capture feedback, and influence product roadmaps—with particular focus on AI and other innovation initiatives that accelerate value.
* Enablement, demos & prototypes: Ensure demo systems, trial environments, and enablement assets are production-ready; support solution advisors and learning teams to deliver scalable training, as well as tailored demos, proofs-of-concept, and prototypes using customer-specific scenarios and data.
* Value proposition & executive engagement: Co-create compelling executive-level narratives and ROI analyses (value leakage, cost-to-serve, TCO improvements) with value advisors; lead strategic discovery and workshops to gain executive alignment and accelerate buying decisions beyond formal RFP cycles.
* Commercial negotiations: Lead complex commercial discussions including pricing, contract terms, and cloud revenue models, balancing customer expectations with profitability and long-term strategic value for the business.
* Adoption & consumption: Partner with Customer Success and adoption teams to drive usage, monitor consumption metrics, manage escalations, secure customer references, and implement continuous improvement actions to maximize realized value.
* Customer success & field impact: Own financial-application deal cycles and renewal negotiations, driving end-to-end field engagement and executive sponsorship to prioritize investments and deliver measurable outcomes tied to agreed KPIs.
* Relationship building & governance: Cultivate C-suite and buying-center relationships to align stakeholders, convert sponsors into advocates, and run Quarterly Business Reviews focused on adoption, innovation, risk mitigation, and opportunity identification.
* Ecosystem & partner engagement: Manage strategic alliances with consulting and systems integrator partners (e.g., McKinsey, Bain, Accenture, Deloitte, PwC, EY), co-developing joint solutions and go-to-market approaches while maintaining close partner account-level relationships.
* Collaboration & orchestration: Orchestrate cross-functional execution with Sales, Product, Marketing, Solution Architects, and Delivery teams to ensure account strategies are integrated into the GTM engine and that responsibilities, timelines, and outcomes are jointly owned.
* Competitive & industry expertise: Maintain up-to-date technical and functional knowledge of SAP and adjacent solutions as well as market and competitor trends; use that insight to position differentiated solutions that address industry-specific challenges and win competitive deals.


  

  

**What You Bring**
  

  

* Experience in sales cycle and quota carry mindset. Previous experience on ASE role.
* Executive relationship building skills with proven C-suite influence to include the Office of the CFO.
* Proven track record of selling Public Cloud ERP over the most recent 4+ years in multiple industries.
* Strong understanding of solution sales, customer value realization, and account planning methodologies; Expansion selling track record (account growth).
* Maps value levers and tell a quantified ROI storytelling and compelling business case creation.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a matrixed environment and influence without direct authority.
* Excellent communication skills in English.


**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better world.
   

  

 SAP is committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provides accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability, in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local legal requirements.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

**AI Usage in the Recruitment Process**
 For information on the responsible use of AI in our recruitment process, please refer to our Guidelines for Ethical Usage of AI in the Recruiting Process.
   

  

 Please note that any violation of these guidelines may result in disqualification from the hiring process.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 445897 | Work Area: Sales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: Virtual - Denmark

title: Senior IT-arkitekt till Tieto Banktech!
description:
*Tieto Banktech är ett framstående företag som utmärker sig genom sin kombination av stabilitet, innovation och en starkt samarbetsinriktad kultur. Som senior IT-arkitekt ansvarar du för att utforma och leda arkitektur- och designarbete med fokus på kvalitet och långsiktigt hållbara lösningar för banksektorn. Du arbetar nära både utvecklingsteam och kunder, och bidrar till att ta fram morgondagens banklösningar för ledande nordiska aktörer.* 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som senior IT-arkitekt hos vår kund kliver du in i en central roll där du ansvarar för att bygga och leda arkitekturen för Nordens främsta banklösningar. Vi söker dig som är en trygg teknisk ledare och som trivs med att vara hands-on – du är teamets vassaste utvecklare som inte bara ritar kartan, utan även konfigurerar miljöer och sätter projektstrukturer från grunden. Du förväntas ha en etablerad senioritet där du rör dig sömlöst mellan strategisk lösningsarkitektur och praktisk programmering.
 



  





 I rollen blir du bryggan mellan teknik och affär. Du hanterar komplexa kundrelationer och agerar som en trovärdig motpart till kundernas chefsarkitekter, särskilt vid uppstart av nya uppdrag där din förmåga att bygga förtroende är avgörande. Genom att kombinera din stabila tekniska kompetens med ett starkt ledarskap driver du transaktionstunga projekt och säkerställer att vår kunds lösningar är både innovativa och långsiktigt hållbara. Hos dem får du chansen att både sätta den tekniska agendan och guida dina kollegor i ett av marknadens mest spännande finansiella landskap.
 



  





**Du erbjuds** 



* En arbetsplats som både erbjuder variation och stabilitet, genom möjligheten att rotera mellan spännande uppdrag och kunder men också genom långsiktiga uppdrag då vår kund har många stabila kundsamarbeten.
* Du erbjuds en trygg anställning med fast lön men stor fokus på kompetens och kvalité. Du får en dedikerad chef med teknisk förståelse om stöttar din långsiktiga utveckling med löpande kompetensutveckling.
* Du blir en del av ett seniort team och en organisation som har en teknisk miljö i framkant. De har ett innovativt tech-community där du får möjligheten att utvecklas tekniskt och växa internt.
* Företaget erbjudet flexibilitet med hybridarbete, sociala aktiviteter som konferenser och AWs samt förmånsportal, pensionsrådgivning och föräldralön med mera.



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 



* Ansvara för lösningsarkitektur och tekniska vägval i komplexa projekt.
* Driva arkitekturarbete och vara en teknisk ledare för utvecklingsteam.
* Samarbeta med andra arkitekter inom arkitekturforum för kompetensutveckling och teknisk påverkan.
* Arbeta med komplexa och volymintensiva systemlösningar, integrationsutmaningar och innovativa utvecklingsprojekt
* Säkerställa hög kvalitet och hållbarhet i levererade lösningar.



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Flera års erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt inom IT, gärna med bakgrund som utvecklare.
* Djup kunskap om systemdesign, systemintegrationer och programmering.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta kundnära och i team.
* God omvärldsbevakning och förmåga att identifiera möjligheter med nya tekniker.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift, då båda språket används i arbetet.



  





**Det är meriterande om du har** 



* Java (Spring, Maven), JavaScript (React) och Python
* Pipelines, Containers (Docker) och Automatisering
* AI-verktyg
* Erfarenhet från bank-, finans- eller fintech-sektorn



  





**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:** 



* Förändringsbenägen
* Ansvarstagande
* Intellektuellt nyfiken
* Målinriktad



  





 Som person ser vi att du är driven och självständig. Det är viktigt att du är kommunikativ och samarbetsinriktad och är nyfiken på tekniska genombrott och har förmåga att blicka framåt. Därtill ser vi att det är viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i en agil och föränderlig miljö.
 



  





**Vår rekryteringsprocess** 




 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 



  





 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Vid ansökan efterfrågas ett CV. Personligt brev använder vi inte som urvalsmetod och behöver därför inte bifogas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.

title: IT-säkerhetsspecialist
description:
**Om Connecting Stockholm** 




 Som ansvariga för Stockholms tunnelbana driver vi en samhällsbärande verksamhet där säkerhet, tillgänglighet och punktlighet står i centrum. Vi kombinerar erfarenhet och nytänkande för att skapa en tunnelbana som är trygg idag och hållbar för framtiden.
 



  





 Men vårt uppdrag handlar om mer än trafik – det handlar om människor, ansvar och tillit. Varje dag möter vi hundratusentals resenärer, och genom ett varmt, respektfullt och professionellt bemötande skapar vi en reseupplevelse där alla känner sig varmt välkomna och trygga. Hos oss är kulturen lika viktig som uppdraget. Vi tror på samarbetets kraft, på relationer som bygger förtroende och på ett ledarskap som präglas av professionalism, hjärta och engagemang.
 



  





 Vi drivs av utveckling – både av vår verksamhet och våra medarbetare. Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa, påverka och vara med och forma framtidens kollektivtrafik – tillsammans med oss.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Vi söker en engagerad IT-säkerhetsspecialist som vill stärka vår organisation genom att skydda vår IT-miljö och säkerställa att vi följer gällande säkerhetsstandarder och lagkrav. I rollen arbetar du nära vår SOC och externa säkerhetspartners för att snabbt identifiera, analysera och åtgärda säkerhetshot – med fokus på penetrationstester, hotanalys, IAM och incidentuppföljning.
 



  





 Samtidigt blir du en viktig del av Connecting Stockholms modernisering av den digitala infrastrukturen bakom tunnelbanan. Här bidrar du direkt till trygg och stabil kollektivtrafik – och gör skillnad för hundratusentals resenärer varje dag.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden** 



* Samarbeta med SOC kring incidentanalys, utveckling av detektionsregler och förbättrad säkerhetsövervakning.
* Kravställa och följa upp penetrationstester, inklusive analys av resultat och implementering av åtgärder.
* Arbeta med Threat Intelligence och analysera hotbilder enligt exempelvis MITRE ATT&CK och Cyber Kill Chain.
* Implementera och administrera IAM-lösningar för säker identitets- och behörighetsstyrning.
* Övervaka och dokumentera säkerhetsloggar i SIEM-miljöer.
* Hantera nyckelhantering enligt branschstandarder (t.ex. AES-256, RSA-4096).
* Bidra till en säker och stabil IT-infrastruktur med fokus på redundans och driftsäkerhet.



  
 



**Kvalifikationer** 




 Du är analytisk, strukturerad och proaktiv. Du tar initiativ, arbetar självständigt och har lätt för att om-sätta tekniska säkerhetsutmaningar till tydliga och verksamhetsanpassade åtgärder.
 



 Vi tror att du har:
 


* Relevant examen eller motsvarande erfarenhet inom IT och informationssäkerhet.
* 3–5 års erfarenhet av IT-säkerhetsarbete, incidenthantering och kravställning.
* Erfarenhet av samarbete med SOC, arbete i SIEM-verktyg och uppföljning av incidenter.
* Förmåga att kravställa penetrationstester och omsätta resultaten i konkreta säkerhetsförbätt-ringar.
* God kännedom om Threat Intelligence och ramverk som ISO27001, NIST, OWASP och CIS Controls.
* Erfarenhet av molnmiljöer som Azure, AWS eller Google Cloud.
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga och trygghet i att förklara tekniska säkerhetsfrågor för olika mål-grupper.



  





**Meriterande kvalifikationer** 



* Certifieringar som CISSP, CISM, CEH, OSCP eller GCTI.
* Erfarenhet av TI-plattformar (t.ex. MISP, ThreatConnect, Recorded Future).
* Erfarenhet av regelverk som GDPR, NIS2 eller andra sektorsspecifika krav.
* Bakgrund inom Safety eller transportsäkerhet.



  





**Övrigt** 



* Anställningsform: Tillsvidare med 6 månaders provanställning.
* Omfattning: Heltid.
* Startdatum: Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
* Placering: Centrala Stockholm.
* Anställningen omfattas av kollektivavtal och erbjuder flera förmåner som till exempel SL-kort, friskvårdsbidrag, lunchförmån och rabatterade försäkringar.



  
 



**Om rekryteringsprocessen** 




 Vi tillämpar kompetensbaserad rekrytering och strävar efter en rättvis och inkluderande process. Som en del av urvalet kan vi använda urvalsfrågor och tester för att säkerställa en objektiv bedömning av kompetens och potential. Referenstagning och eventuell bakgrundskontroll kan också komma att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas
 



  





 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post. Vid frågor kontakta gärna rekryteringen via rekrytering@connectingstockholm.se.

title: Automation Engineer to Polygon Group
description:
*Do you want to play a key role in a global organization where automation drives real business impact? Do you enjoy taking ownership, shaping smart solutions, and working closely with stakeholders across countries?*
*If you're motivated by influence, responsibility and real change — this might be your next step.*
**YOUR EVERYDAY WORK**
 As an Automation Engineer, you will be central to Polygon Group’s digital transformation. You collaborate closely with both business and IT to design, build, and improve end‑to‑end automation solutions that streamline processes and boost operational efficiency. You work hands‑on with Power Platform, UiPath, and cloud‑based environments, while contributing to governance, continuous improvement, and AI‑enablement. The role offers autonomy, variation, and the opportunity to help build a scalable automation framework and a growing automation community across multiple countries.
   

  

**YOUR PROFILE**
 You thrive in a dynamic environment and enjoy creating structure, clarity, and well‑designed technical solutions. You communicate confidently, lead workshops with ease, and translate business needs into smart automation. With curiosity and initiative, you help drive improvements while shaping modern ways of working.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 5+ years’ experience in automation, RPA or low‑code platforms
* Proven experience delivering end‑to‑end automation projects
* Strong skills in Power Apps and Power Automate
* Solid background in UiPath development
* Understanding of automation, robotics and AI capabilities
* Experience with Microsoft 365, Entra ID and Azure
* Knowledge of Power Platform governance and ALM
* Experience with APIs, integrations and workflow automation
* Ability to scale, maintain and troubleshoot automation solutions
* Fluent in English, spoken and written


**About Polygon Group**
 Polygon – Always by your side
   

  

 Polygon is a major worldwide player in property damage control, providing solutions to prevent, control and mitigate all kinds of property damage. The basis for our success is our +8,000 committed employees, guided by a strong corporate culture. We see ourselves as the new generation of Property Damage Control specialists – determined to drive industry transformation.
   

  

 We are based in modern offices on Mäster Samuelsgatan in central Stockholm and apply an office‑first policy across the organization.
   

  

**CONTACT**
 In this recruitment, Polygon Group is collaborating with Wise IT. If you would like to know more, please contact the responsible Recruitment Consultant Sandra Åhs at Sandra.ahs@wise.se
   

  

 Unfortunately, we cannot accept applications via email as we are committed to protecting your personal privacy. You can read more about how we process personal data in accordance with GDPR in Wise Group’s Data Processing Policy.
   

  

 We review applications on an ongoing basis, including the selection of candidates who will be invited to interview.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Sr. Director, Analyst - Public Cloud Sourcing Expert Focus (Remote: Europe)
description:
Gartner seeks a Senior Director Analyst to provide Business and Technology Insights services to global clients in
 **Sourcing, Procurement, and Vendor Management** 
 . The role will focus on
 **public cloud** 
**optimization and transformation services (PCOTS)** 
 , requiring knowledge and experience in sourcing Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure Cloud, and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure services. You will leverage your extensive industry experience to guide clients through their buying journeys for complex IT services, helping them navigate evolving cloud strategies, optimize costs, and achieve transformational business outcomes. In addition to the knowledge specific to the cloud market, this position requires experience in sourcing other IT infrastructure services, such as data center outsourcing, managed security services, and digital workplace services. Additional data and analytics experience and sourcing application services would be a plus.
   

  

 The candidate will advise Gartner clients on negotiating and administering high-value, multiyear contracts with key cloud vendors such as AWS, Azure, Oracle, and other IT Infrastructure services. This involves leveraging a data-driven approach, combining forecasts derived from internal usage metrics with market intelligence, to secure favorable pricing, flexible commitment terms, and robust service level agreements.
   

  

**As a Senior Director, Analyst focusing on Public Cloud Sourcing, you will:**
* Research and Thought Leadership: Create innovative, thought-provoking, and highly leveraged “must-have research” content to help sourcing and CxO clients achieve required business outcomes from Outsourced IT Services. Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing provocative and pragmatic research positions, collaborating across a team of analysts.
* Advisory Services: Provide high-quality, actionable advice through various media (written responses, presentations, webinars, or inquiry calls). Guide clients in selecting providers for application-led, cloud-native transformation projects and ongoing public cloud managed services.
* Sourcing Strategy and Negotiation: Advise Gartner clients on leading end-to-end sourcing projects for public cloud services. Formulate and implement comprehensive sourcing strategies focused on public cloud services, identifying best-fit solutions among cloud providers. Advise clients on leading negotiations for multiyear contracts, ensuring favorable pricing, volume discounts, flexible commitment terms, and optimal service level agreements (SLAs).
* Contract Management and Risk Mitigation: Advise clients on negotiating optimal contract terms, focusing on cost optimization, vendor performance, and risk mitigation. Identify and address contractual risks such as overly rigid renewal terms, audit clauses, and unfavorable escalation of support fees. Support clients by reviewing client contracts for Outsourced IT Services, identifying gaps in the commercial terms or SLAs.
* Market Intelligence and Analysis: Continuously monitor trends in cloud service pricing, vendor discount programs, and contractual terms, using data sources and benchmark pricing information to drive negotiations.


**Education And Experience**
* Educational Background: A bachelor’s degree in business administration, supply chain management, computer science, or a related field is required; a master’s degree is preferred.
* Industry Experience: 15+ years of relevant field or industry experience gained either through a sourcing role or within a provider tendering and negotiating the delivery of IT services is required. At least three years of direct experience in IT procurement or strategic sourcing—specifically involving cloud contracts with hyperscale vendors like AWS and enterprise software vendors like Oracle—is also necessary.
* Negotiation Track Record: Proven experience negotiating high-value public cloud contracts, demonstrating success in leveraging competitive bidding and cost optimization strategies.
* Domain Knowledge: Deep knowledge of public cloud optimization and transformation services (PCOTS) is essential, including experience with cloud-native professional and managed services and utilization of hyperscale cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI). Oracle workload expertise (e.g., PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, E-Business Suite) is preferred.


**Required Skills And Analyst Capabilities**
 The ideal candidate must demonstrate the capabilities required for a Senior Director Analyst:
   

  

* The passion, drive, and enthusiasm to help sourcing executives and CxO clients with their IT services sourcing initiatives.
* Intellectual agility to learn new topics and develop the necessary expertise to advise Gartner clients on best practices.
* Demonstrates domain and quantitative expertise: Ability to gather and analyze data to drive insights for new research. Work must reflect in-depth knowledge of the content area.
* Brings provocative, independent insights to ideation sessions, feeding into new research.
* Energized by the challenges of taking on client interactions that are not necessarily their primary coverage area, helping Gartner clients whenever possible.
* Ability to present to small or large audiences in different venues and settings.
* Comfortable presenting in all settings—from 1:1 conversations to large group, cross-functional interactions. Including the ability to pick up a peer’s presentation and deliver it successfully.
* Effectively reframes client problems to identify root causes and potential solutions.
* Organizes Efficiently: Must be able to prioritize and manage workflow independently.
* Consistently keeps work on track to support the goals of the team/business.
* Collaborates Productively: Regarded as a thought-partner and coach across the practice, leveraging their peer network across Gartner Research to co-write and/or co-produce research.
* Takes feedback on board and applies it positively, constantly striving to improve.


 #Remote
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective business and technology insights, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our vast, virtually untapped market potential offers limitless opportunities – opportunities that may not even exist right now – for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:104944
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Systemarkitekt till Fire Control Systems!
description:
*Vill du arbeta med avancerad försvarsteknik och bidra till att utveckla några av världens främsta system för spårning och identifiering av mål?*
 Hos oss på
 **Naval Combat Systems** 
 blir du en viktig del i utvecklingen av högteknologiska produkter som används på både marina plattformar och landbaserade fordon. Du följer projekten genom hela livscykeln – från kravanalys och design till integration, verifiering och leverans.
   

  

 Rollen innebär många kontaktytor, både internt och externt, vilket gör arbetet både varierande och utvecklande. Du får även möjlighet att arbeta med avancerad teknik och bidra till system som används internationellt.
   

  

**UTAAS** 
 (Universal Tank and Anti-Aircraft System) är ett mångsidigt sikt- och eldledningssystem för stridsvagnar och stridsfordon, som ger hög träffsannolikhet mot markmål och luftmål. Läs mer här.
   

  

**Trackfire** 
 är ett stabiliserat, fjärrmanövrerat vapen- och sensorsystem som kan användas på fordon, fartyg och fasta installationer, och ger hög prestanda oavsett miljö. Läs mer här.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Järfälla och resor kan förekomma.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**
* Hantera och bryta ner tekniska krav till hanterbara nivåer
* Utforma produkt- och systemarkitektur inklusive gränssnitt
* Stödja konstruktörer och utvecklare i systemstrukturering
* Följa systemet genom design, integration och verifiering
* Delta i offertarbete vid behov


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är civil- eller högskoleingenjör och har erfarenhet av produktutveckling. Du är strukturerad, analytisk och trivs med att tänka både strategiskt och kommersiellt. Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift, är ett krav. Vi ser gärna att du har god samarbetsförmåga, lätt att bygga nätverk och uppskattar att arbeta i team.
   

  

**Meriterande med erfarenhet inom:**
* Kravhantering och systemarkitektur
* Sensorer (laser, IR, elektrooptik)
* Optik, ballistik, styr- och reglersystem
* Embedded-programvara, elektronik- och mekanikkonstruktion
* Verktyg som DOORS och Enterprise Architect


 Vi värdesätter också personliga egenskaper som positiv energi, förmågan att engagera och entusiasmera samt en god kommunikationsförmåga som får teamet att sträva mot gemensamma mål.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: 🌍 Account Manager B2G (Sverige / Norden)
description:
**Vårt uppdrag 👋** 




 På ParkingAid hjälper vi kommuner och städer att förstå, styra och optimera parkering med hjälp av AI och data. Resultatet: mindre trängsel, bättre trafikflöden och mer hållbara stadsmiljöer.
 



  





 Vi är ett snabbväxande SaaS-bolag som nu stärker vårt team med en
 **Account Manager B2G** 
 som vill ta ansvar för försäljning mot svensk och nordisk offentlig sektor.
 



  





**Om rollen 🙋** 




 I den här rollen driver du affärer mot
 **kommuner, städer och offentliga aktörer** 
 . Du ansvarar för hela kundresan – från prospektering och tidig dialog till affär, upphandling och långsiktigt kundansvar.
 



 Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt, med stor frihet att driva egna initiativ och utveckla hur vi jobbar med B2G-försäljning framåt.
 



  





**Ditt uppdrag 💪** 



* Driva nykundsbearbetning och försäljning mot offentlig sektor i Sverige och Norden
* Äga kunddialoger och affärsprocesser från första kontakt till avtal
* Arbeta med längre säljcykler, inklusive upphandlingar där det är relevant
* Bygga och vårda långsiktiga relationer med kommuner och beslutsfattare
* Delta i branschmässor, event och nätverk
* Vara med och utveckla ParkingAids B2G-erbjudande och säljprocesser



  





**Vem du är ✨** 



* Affärsdriven, strukturerad och självgående
* En stark relationsbyggare och god lyssnare
* Trivs i komplexa affärer där förtroende är avgörande
* Gillar att ta ansvar och driva projekt framåt



  





**Vad du har gjort tidigare ⭐** 



* Erfarenhet av försäljning eller affärsutveckling
* Van att arbeta med prospektering, kunddialoger och affärsprocesser
* Förstår kundens behov och kan översätta dem till värdeskapande lösningar
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift (engelska som arbetsspråk)



  





**Extra plus om du också har 🌟** 



* Erfarenhet av offentlig sektor och/eller upphandlingar
* SaaS- eller tech-bakgrund
* Jobbat i startup- eller tillväxtbolag
* Intresse för mobilitet, smarta städer eller AI-drivna lösningar



  





**Varför ParkingAid? 🎁** 



* Stort mandat och möjlighet att påverka hur vi jobbar mot offentlig sektor
* Tillväxtresa med optionsprogram
* Litet, engagerat team med höga ambitioner
* Grundlön + rörlig del samt möjlighet till kvalificerade personaloptioner.



  





**📩 Ansökan** 




 Sök via LinkedIn eller kontakta oss direkt – vi intervjuar löpande.

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer - B2B Experience
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.** 




  





**The role** 




 As a Senior Fullstack Engineer in the B2B Experience team, you’ll design and build end-to-end product workflows for team collaboration, access management, and workspace administration, used daily by Epidemic Sound’s largest customers. Working across both frontend and backend, you’ll turn core platform capabilities into intuitive, reliable experiences for organisations operating at scale. As a founding member of this newly formed team, you will have the unique opportunity to help grow the squad and define our technical foundation from the ground up.
 



 This role directly supports our B2B growth by improving how customers adopt the product, scale usage across teams, and realize value over time. You’ll join a cross-functional team of product-minded engineers, designers, and product managers, and collaborate closely with platform and enabling teams across the company.
 



  





**Your Key Responsibilities Include** 



* Design, build, and maintain end-to-end features for team collaboration, workspace management, and administrative workflows
* Develop scalable, high-quality frontend and backend solutions with a strong focus on reliability and user experience
* Collaborate closely with Product and Design to shape solutions from discovery to delivery
* Integrate with shared platform services and contribute to cross-team technical initiatives
* Own features in production, including testing, monitoring, and continuous improvement



  





**Requirements** 



* 5+ years of experience building and maintaining both frontend and backend systems
* Strong frontend experience with React, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS
* Proven experience in at least one backend language (e.g. Go, Python, or Node.js) building production systems
* Solid understanding of distributed systems and system design principles
* Experience working with modern CI/CD pipelines
* Willingness to work with Go as we continue to evolve our backend stack
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate across disciplines



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience operating in cloud environments (GCP preferred, AWS welcome)
* Experience with event tracking using Snowplow or similar tools
* Familiarity with Prometheus and Grafana
* Experience with frontend testing using Playwright



  





**How you work** 




 You’re curious, proactive, and thoughtful. You enjoy solving real-world problems at scale and take pride in delivering reliable software. You’re someone who thrives in a dynamic environment, embraces uncertainty, and sees change as an opportunity to learn and adapt. You’re someone who:
 


* Navigates change with ease
* Shares knowledge generously
* Works collaboratively and transparently
* Thinks long-term while executing short-term



  





**Equal opportunity employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Ready to make the world feel your work? Apply now by clicking the link below! We embrace a hybrid model but love collaborating in person, so we spend the majority of our time in the office.
 



  





***Thinking about joining us? Tune in
 
 here
 
 - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***

title: Full-Stack .NET & Azure Developer
description:
Passionate about coding? Join us as a .NET Azure Developer and solve exciting challenges with a talented, supportive tech team!
 



  





 At If IT, we work intensively to develop and adapt our solutions to meet our customers in the digital world. We build our solutions based on modern Microsoft Technology. The goal is to develop our IT-landscape according to a Nordic agenda and give our customers the best possible experience. We are now looking for a skilled full-stack .NET Azure Developer to join our Nordic development team. The position is based in Turku (Finland) or Stockholm (Sweden).
 



  





**About The Role** 




 In this role, you will work with our most modern IT-systems. You will be an important member of a Nordic development team, building .NET Azure applications and services for our Nordic Customer Centers. You will enable our Frontliners to provide World Class Service to our Customers. We enjoy, for example, trunk-based development, Event Sourcing, automated tests as documentation, functional programming concepts and pipelines/infrastructure as code.
 



  





 Some of the technologies we are using:
 


* .NET/C#
* Typescript /JavaScript/React
* Azure: App Service, Functions, Service Bus, Cosmos DB, AI Search



  





 This could be a great opportunity for you to learn new technology, so you don´t need to be an expert in all these areas today.
 



  





**We offer** 




 Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
 


* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Lunch benefit
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits



  





**About The Team** 




 The team is a distributed team of 13 people based in Turku and Stockholm. Most of them are experienced developers, and the whole team collaborates daily in a positive and constructive atmosphere.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




 You have five years of system development experience in relevant technologies. It´s important that you have a genuine interest in technology and are a skilled developer. We work in an agile environment, and you are familiar with these principles.
 



 We prefer that you have an academic education in IT, but relevant experience and competence are also important. You are a curious and positive person. It´s easy for you to communicate with colleagues in English and preferably also in a local language (Finnish or Swedish).
 



  





**Additional Facts And The Recruitment Process** 




**Application deadline:** 
 Screening and interviewing will start immediately. However, application deadline is 6th of February.
 



**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach your CV and answer the questions in the application form.
 



**Work location:** 
 Turku (Finland) or Stockholm (Sweden).
 



**Start:** 
 According to agreement.
 



*Background checks for this position will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment* 
 .
 



  





 We look forward to your application!

title: Senior Business Controller
description:

**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Identify and assess current Business Control activities
* Gather requirements from Group Function managers
* Develop proposals for standardization and simplification of processes in collaboration with the manager of the group where the Business Control assignment will be transferred
* Partially perform the Business Controller role while simultaneously:
* Mapping the current state and future needs

**Requirements**

 :

**Nice to have:**

**Individual qualitites:** 



* Communicative
* Self-driven
* Solution-oriented
* Driven

title: Systemintegratör för mjukvaruprojekt
description:
På Sylog letar vi efter erfarna integratörer, testare eller mjukvaruutvecklare som är redo att engagera sig i betydelsefulla projekt hos vår kund.
   

  

 Som integratör hos Sylog får du chansen att arbeta i hjärtat av innovation inom säkerhetskritiska sektorer. Vi erbjuder en transparens och teknikdriven arbetsmiljö där det finns gott om utrymme för personlig och professionell tillväxt. Med kunskap, passion och frihet som våra ledord, är vår ambition att du ska känna att du kan påverka både din karriär och ditt privatliv i så stor utsträckning som möjligt. Eftersom vi vet att balans och nöjdhet leder till bättre prestationer.
   

  

 Som anställd konsult hos Sylog kommer du att få engagera dig i högteknologiska produkter och komplexa system som utmanar och utvecklar din expertis. Uppdragen är av långsiktig karaktär och när det väl är dags att testa något nytt, ger vår breda kundbas dig flera vägar att utforska.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
 I rollen som integratör kommer du att hantera mångsidiga uppgifter relaterade till att utveckla, underhålla och optimera systemens bygg- och utvecklingsmiljöer hos kund. Du kommer att hantera integration av både hård- och mjukvarukomponenter i kundens plattformar.
   

  

 För att lyckas i denna roll bör du ha en god förståelse för samspelet mellan mjukvara och hårdvara. Du är en kommunikativ person som trivs i samarbeten med både kollegor och kunder. Ditt arbete kommer att innefatta direkt samarbete med slutkunder för att säkerställa en smidig och effektiv implementering och driftsättning av systemen. Du bidrar även med värdefull teknisk vägledning och stöttning till utvecklarna för att kunna säkerställa kvalitet samt effektiviteten i projektet.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet från projekt som ställer höga krav på prestanda, skalbarhet och säkerhet.
* Akademisk bakgrund inom datorsystem, elektronik eller motsvarande.
* God förståelse för komplexa systemmiljöer.
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom programmering och felsökning, python är önskvärt.
* Tidigare erfarenhet inom system och funktionstest.
* Du är strukturerad och noggrann med en stark kvalitetsmedvetenhet.
* Erfarenhet inom både Installation och drift.
* God kommunikativ förmåga och flytande i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.
* Svenskt medborgarskap.
* Minst 5 års relevant erfarenhet


 Erfarenhet av att arbeta inom någon eller flera av dessa områden är önskvärt:
   

  

* Telecom
* Fordon
* Medtech
* Försvar
* Flyg
* Tåg


**Varför Sylog?**
 På Sylog förstår vi att våra medarbetare är hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Därför är det självklart att vår verksamhet är inriktad på att stödja och främja din utveckling. Hos oss blir du en del av ett personalfokuserat konsultbolag med korta beslutsvägar och ger dig goda möjligheter att påverka din egen anställning och möjligheten att bidra med idéer till Sylogs växande verksamhet. Vi driver utvecklingen framåt för både branschen och våra kunders långsiktiga behov.
   

  

 Följande saker är exempel på vad du som anställd kan förvänta dig:
   

  

* Transparens, flexibilitet och stort självbestämmande kring din anställning och val av uppdrag.
* Stabil, lyhörd och initiativdriven organisation.
* Låg personalomsättning.
* Marknadsmässig lön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och diverse försäkringar.
* Stort nätverk, omfattande kundbas med direktkontakter och ett dedikerat säljteam.
* Generösa möjligheter till sociala och kompetensutvecklande aktiviteter under året.
* Årliga konferensresor.


 💡
 **Vill du ha ytterligare information? Vi vill gärna höra från dig!**

title: Adobe Campaign Classic Technical Consultant (Insurance)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Financial Services team is at the forefront of this mission. As a reliable partner we guide our customers such as major banks and insurance companies with everything from strategy and planning to implementation and management.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Adobe Campaign Classic Consultant, you will play a key role in customizing and developing solutions within Adobe Campaign Classic to meet requirements. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will deliver solutions that align with business objectives. These solutions may include technical workflows, campaign triggers, landing pages, and custom implementations. Your responsibilities also cover incident management. Additionally, you will manage projects with accuracy and attention to detail, ensuring alignment with the global Adobe Campaign strategy.
   

  

**Your profile**
* 6+ years of experience with marketing automation solutions like Adobe Campaign Classic and Adobe Campaign Standard.
* Knowledge of Marketing Management across multiple Channels (Email, SMS, Outbound, Direct Mail, Push).
* 3+ years of developer experience with Adobe Campaign Classic.
* Experience with integrating Adobe Campaign Classic with other Adobe solutions, external DBs and custom API integrations.
* Proficiency in JavaScript, XML, HTML/CSS
* Insurance domain experience is preferred.
* Proficiency in Swedish is a plus and candidates based in Sweden will be prioritized.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* You get to work with major customers within banking and insurance, in exciting and varied roles, giving you the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally.
* The freedom to make decisions, manage your time, and work independently - fostering creativity, innovation, and job satisfaction.
* An extensive benefits package, including parental benefits, occupational and flex pension, private insurance, preventive healthcare, and more.
* A variety of social and wellness activities, from sports and health programs to cultural events and art initiatives, designed to bring employees together and enrich work life.


*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted. More information will be provided if applicable.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Make it real |** 
**www.capgemini.com**

title: Finnish Speaking Account Executive
description:
****Are you a results driven, Finnish speaking Salesperson? You might be our next Account Executive!** 
 🚀**
 We’re looking for you – a highly motivated salesperson ready to roll up your sleeves and achieve rapid success, both for yourself and for us.
   

  

 This is your chance to sell a groundbreaking B2B SaaS platform with short sales cycles – and
 **no commission cap!** 
 With Tendium’s platform at your disposal, you can reach new heights if you play your cards right.
   

  

****Who Are You?****
 We’re looking for a driven and ambitious colleague with the right attitude. Relevant experience is a plus, but
 **MINDSET** 
 is key!
   

  

**What You Bring**
* A goal-oriented mindset — you’re motivated to reach the top.
* Some sales experience, preferably in B2B or SaaS.
* Fluency in Finnish, proficiency in English and at least a basic understanding of Swedish.


****Bonus points if you...****
* Have additional language skills — Swedish is especially valued, but other European languages (B2+ level and above) are a plus.
* Previous experience in a tech company, familiarity with public procurements or an existing network in Finland are seen as advantages.


 You thrive on
 **building relationships, closing deals, and pushing through challenges** 
 , even when faced with a “no.” If you’re ready to grow with us, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**Your Role at Tendium**
 As an Account Executive, you will drive new customer sales for Tendium’s SaaS platform in Finland and Europe. You’ll manage the full sales cycle, from prospecting to closing deals, with support from the marketing team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Drive new sales via phone and video meetings.
* Qualify leads and initiate business discussions.
* Present Tendium’s value proposition.
* Build and convert a strong sales pipeline.
* Collaborate with the team to close deals.


*This is a full-time, permanent position with a six-month probation period, a base salary, and commission.*
**About Tendium**
 Tendium is an
 **AI-driven scale-up** 
 revolutionising
 **public procurement** 
 . We provide businesses with a
 **smarter and easier way** 
 to participate in public tenders. At
 **Tendium** 
 , you’ll be part of a growing team backed by strong investors. We’re
 **an engaged, friendly, and open team** 
 where every member gets the space to grow.
   

  

**Ready for the next step? 💼**
 We look forward to your application! We are hiring continuously, so apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 Successful candidates in the recruitment process will be asked to record two short videos - one video
 **introducing yourself (in English)** 
 , and one with a
 **brief pitch where you sell Tendium to us (in Finnish)** 
 – as if we were a potential customer.
   

  

 To make this process even more efficient, sign in to your Connect profile and add your references at any stage.
   

  

 Please find additional information on our recruitment process here. If you want to know more about our culture and what you can expect when working at Tendium you can read more about it
 *here.*
 We can’t wait to hear from you! 🚀
   

  

 At Tendium we’re using data to transform public procurement, giving our clients better access to public tenders and helping governments to curb waste and enhance transparency.
   

  

 For more information contact career@tendium.com

title: SAP-Finance Konsult
description:
Vi söker en driven senior
 **SAP-Finance konsult** 
 till vårt växande SAP-team. Vi söker dig som tycker om att träffa kunder och att diskutera effektiviserings- och automatiseringsmöjligheterna med SAP S/4HANA utifrån ett Fiori- och Agentic way of working. Vi ser därför att du har en stark Finance-bakgrund och erfarenhet av SAP S/4HANA, gärna Public Cloud, och erfarenheten av att leverera lösningar från identifierad utmaning, till verifierad effekt hos kunden.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder dig** 



* Möjligheten att jobba med många av Sveriges mest framstående företag och organisationer
* Intressanta och utmanande uppdrag
* Kompetenta kollegor med några av de bästa experterna inom SAP
* En möjlighet till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling där du får möjlighet att ständigt utveckla dina kunskaper



  





 Avega lägger stort fokus på din kontinuerliga utveckling där ditt uppdrag tillsammans med Avegas kompetensforum Elevate är viktiga komponenter för att du ska lyckas.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 




 I denna roll kommer du att:
 


* Bygga starka kundrelationer,
* I samtal med kunden, i tidiga skeden, identifiera möjligheter med SAP S/4HANA och därefter förbereda och leda workshops för att samla in krav och driva lösningsdesign.
* Designa, konfigurera och underhålla SAP Finance-modulen och stödja användarna.
* Driva lösningen genom alla faser av ett SAP-projekt och säkerställa kundnöjdhet och tidplan.
* Samarbeta med andra SAP områden såsom Sales and Procurement and Supply Chain och ha en god förståelse för SAP:s ekosystem och tvärfunktionella beroenden.



  





**Din profil:** 



* 6+ års hands-on erfarenhet av SAP med fokus på finanslösningar och processer.
* Erfarenhet från minst en full S/4HANA-transformation.
* Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet och kunskap inom SAP Activate.
* Vi ser gärna att du har kunskap och förståelse kring SAP:s erbjudanden RISE with SAP och GROW with SAP.



  





 Låter detta som rätt matchning för dig? Sök nedan och vi ser fram emot att prata vidare.

title: Power System Engineer
description:
**Description**


**The Opportunity**


Seize this opportunity to take on a highly visible position in a global organization. As a Power System Engineer you will belong to Power Consulting, a department within Hitachi Energy working with both internal and external clients in the energy sector. You will be part of a renowned global team of power system and energy consultants. In the role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the green transition and create a more sustainable energy future for all.


So, if you want to take the next step in your career, and contribute to develop a stronger, smarter, and greener energy system – Join us now! We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join it!

**How you'll make an impact**

* In this exciting role, you will get the opportunity to take part in major assignments related to the green energy transition together with our consultants and experts from local as well as international Power Consulting offices.
* The assignments for the role are mainly system studies within the area of HVDC, FACTS, renewable energy integration, green hydrogen and power systems in general.
* As a Power Systems Engineer, you are expected to take lead in assignments towards clients and to provide effective support in ongoing projects.
* Cooperation and work in teams with leading specialists together with Hitachi Energy well-defined career path ensures exciting and motivating career with fast development along own interests and personality traits.
* You will be living Hitachi Energy core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

 **Your Background**

* You hold a Master’s degree in electrical engineering, electrical power systems or similar.
* You have a great interest and preferably three years of experience in the consulting and energy sector.
* Knowledge in power systems analysis and in software simulation tools such as PSS/E, PSCAD and/or DIgSILENT PowerFactory.
* Programming skill in Python, C++, etc. is a merit.
* You have an analytical mindset, you are independent, self-going and take your own initiatives to solve problems.
* As a person, you are collaborative and communicative.
* It is necessary to be fluent in English. Swedish is meritorious.

 **What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**

The position is based in Stockholm (Solna) or Gothenburg.


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join!


Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting Manager, Joel Henriksson Larsson, joel.henriksson-larsson@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 25 73; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. title: Process Engineer - Battery Production
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.  

  

Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.**Role Summary**

We are looking for a new colleague to join our engineering team in the battery production.

The Process Engineering role in our module production line is Product, Quality and method oriented.

If you have the Experience and want to be part of a high performing, tight knit and value creating team of engineers working towards a more sustainable future, we are looking forward to your application! We want to find a person who can contribute to the good cooperation and high spirit within our team and organisation.

You will have the possibility to affect the development and costumer production of Scania’s batteries to ensure a safe and sustainable production and usage of our products. You will work with internal and external stakeholders and communicate with colleagues on all levels.

At Scania we strive for continuous improvements, therefore the development and documentation of our common ways of working is part of the job.**Job responsibilities**

As a process engineer, the main tasks include:  

* Leading introductions of new parts and quality improvements in the production line
* Developing the right methods and ensuring conditions to achieve quality, at the right time and cost for manufacturing
* Analysing quality deviations and problem solving together with the line organisation and Scania’s R&D department
* Ensuring documentation and traceability of parts and changes, assessing risks and finding countermeasures in PPAP methods
* Improving cleanliness results in the production area and processes
**Who you are**

We believe that you are a curious and driven person who enjoys finding solutions to small and big problems. You have a hands-on approach and eager to contribute. You are generous with your learnings and are efficient in establishing methods with ability to achieve results in tasks with a wide scope with your ability to break tasks down to manageable steps and when the task calls for it you can dig into details and analyse trends  

  

As we are on standby to support our colleagues in production with trouble shooting and problem solving during unplanned production stops, it is important that you are flexible and have good communication skills.  

  

You take responsibility for breaking down, planning and delivering your tasks on time and ensure the progress of your activities independently as we are in an Agile transformation and working towards self sufficient teams.

Qualifications  

* We highly appreciate the diversity of our team, and we encourage applicants of all genders, ages and backgrounds
* Previous experience of Quality, Industrial or process engineering
* Bachelor or Master of Science degree, Scania Technician (internal education) or similar experience from previous relevant roles
* You have a deep understanding of Scania’s production processes such as PPAP, Product development and Introductions
* Professional level of spoken and written in both English and Swedish
**This is us**

We are here to make a difference.

We are a diverse team with different levels of experience, spanning from a few months to several years of expertise. Together, we are now exploring an exciting new area of the automotive industry, Battery Production. As a production engineering team, we are responsible for the quality and continuous improvements of our processes, equipment and software solutions in our fully automated module production line in Södertälje.  

  

As a manager, I strongly see the benefits of a productive and supportive teamwork. I do my best in creating an atmosphere where all team members understand and feel the importance of their contributions. For our team to create the most value, I believe it is important to be clear where we are, where we are heading and why we are going in that direction.**Scania offers**

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options when possible., including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.  

  

Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.**Application**  


Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.  

  

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-02-18. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.  

  

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:  

group manager Gabriyel Tasel, gabriyel.tasel@scania.com.  

  

We look forward to your application!

title: Project Engineer/Planner - Sweden
description:
At Aquatech, we tackle the challenges of water scarcity and complexity by leveraging technology, expertise, and financing to deliver comprehensive solutions that reduce carbon and recycled water footprint. As a leading global provider of water and process technology solutions, we help the world's most recognized companies achieve their sustainability and operational goals by implementing innovative approaches for water reuse, desalination, minimal and zero liquid discharge, and critical minerals recovery. Our work catalyzes the transition toward a more sustainable future and showcases our commitment to addressing water's role in climate adaptation. Learn more at www.aquatech.com


Aquatech has an immediate need for a full-time Project Engineer/Planner to work on our site in Boden, Sweden.


The ideal candidate will be organized, have excellent math skills, applied creativity, mechanical skills, problem-solving skills, team-oriented, customer service driven, and have attention to detail. This candidate will also have experience in a project-related industry.

**Job Description**

* Review of Project specifications
* Preparation of Project Documents
* Maintain the Project Master document list.
* Lead project design coordination with internal engineering departments, external engineering agencies, and Site Contractors.
* Coordinate engineering document submissions to customers & vendors.
* Facilitate timely engineering reviews of vendor quotes.
* Review vendor quotes and purchase requisitions for compliance with project specifications.
* Responsible for accurately reporting engineering progress in the project schedule.
* Coordinate the collection of necessary inputs to the 3D model and the resolution of issue tags.
* Provide status, control, and progress reporting support services on projects.
* Prepare project schedules per project requirements.
* Verify the project progress & prepare the monthly progress report.
* Vendor follow-up & expediting
* Periodic vendor visits to monitor the progress.
* Attend Customer meetings as required.
* Support correspondence with customers via the Project manager.
* Internal communication with all departments & AIC Assembly shop.
* Track material status in SAP & update project status
* Preparation of packing slips & related shipment documentation
* Site visits during the construction phase
* Coordinate engineering responses to RFI from subcontractors
* Expedite critical engineering solutions during the construction phase.
* Ensure design changes are properly communicated to the project team and incorporated into the 3D model.
* Oversee as-built documentation for the project.
* Work autonomously without constant guidance
* 10% International and Domestic travel will be required.

**Skill Requirements:**

* Able to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems.
* Time management and organizational skills.
* Ability to read, analyze, and interpret complex documents.
* Ability to read and interpret AutoCAD engineering drawings and P&IDs.
* Ability to communicate effectively with customers and maintain a positive attitude.
* Ability to work with multiple disciplines on projects.
* Ability to plan and manage multiple tasks or projects with attention to detail.
* Ability to use MS Office software at a high level of proficiency.
* Ability to use SAP.
* Ability to use Primavera P6 preferred.
* Experience using AutoCAD 2D and Plant 3D preferred.

**Essential Functions:**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above and below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

**Physical Job Demands:**


Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time, limited walking, and standing.




* Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering
* Five (5) or more years of experience in a project-related industry
* Prior water/wastewater infrastructure project experience preferred.
